prompt:
More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. 
Do advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages?
essay:
Nowadays, most individuals chose to have kids in their later age compared to what it used to be in the past. In my opinion, I believe it is more beneficial to have kids at later age than at young age because it makes one fully prepared for child care and also reduces the rate of over population.

On the one hand, there are many advantages of late child birth. Firstly, it enables one to be fully ready for the responsibilities that come with having children. This means that when people delay giving birth till their later age, by then they would have been well established financially, morally and education wise. The reality is that people who give birth early are not yet ready for the consequent duty of care. This difference can be seen when comparing  children education between the American and the Nigerian. Early child birth has made many Nigerian unable to afford their kids' education, whereas, the American which mostly give birth at later age have highest level of children education. It can, therefore, be logically deduced that giving birth at later life prepares one for the task of caring for them. Secondly, giving birth at later age helps to control population rate. If people start having kids at young age, they tend to have many kids before menopause, hence delaying child birth will help individual family to give birth to fewer children.

Despite the numerous benefits of giving birth at later life, it however, has some few drawbacks. First of it is the reduced chances of conception. Scientists have shown that the best chance of conception is between the age of 18 years to 28 years and the chances keep decreasing with age. This means that people who decide to wait till later age risk not having kids at all. Furthermore, delaying child birth could also result in certain complications during labour and delivery. For instance, conditions like miscarriage, early onset of labour and other complications, are associated with pregnancy at later life.

In conclusion, although, birthing children at later age has its merits and downsides, on the balance, I however believe the benefits surpass any drawbacks it may have.

On the other hand, group games help to improve leadership skills, which is important for everyone, especially in later life. As every team contains a captain, it helps to develop his captainship skills. Developing  guardianship skills for everyone, and rotating the leader in every game can help. Thus, every child is preparing themselves to become a leader. Furthermore, it also helps the other students to follow the instructions of the leader. Consequently, they are developing respect in their mind, which is important for the future. As a consequence, there will be less chance of conflict in the future.

To sum up, team sport helps the students for their next life. Therefore, I believe that if scholars follow this, we will get some future leaders, for whom we are struggling now.

While various methods exist, I strongly believe that this solution is the best way to cooperate teenagers between them. In this essay, I will discuss why I hold this view and provide two supporting reasons.

To begin with, company game provides self-discipline which teaches younger how to work collaboratively. It is one of the main keys for success, fostering crucial interpersonal skills. For instance, in a volleyball team, players must know and understand how to communicate with each other to provide their strategy for achieving goals. Consequently, the collaborative experience not only teaches infants the significant role of working together, but also helps them develop strong bonds with their teammates.

Secondly, children are exposed to both success and failure together, which has an essential impact on collective responsibility. When a team succeeds, each member shares in the victory, reinforcing the idea that cooperation leads to mutual benefits. For example, in moments of failure, kids learn to support and uplift one another, understanding that overcoming challenges requires collective effort. As a result, this shared experience contributes significantly to character development and prepares them for future collaborative endeavors.

In conclusion, team sports at school stand out as the most effective method for teaching infants cooperation. The structured environment, coupled with exposure to success and failure as a team, imparts invaluable life skills. By engaging in team sports, teenagers learn to collaborate effectively and develop a sense of collective responsibility that will serve them well in their future endeavors.

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The assertion that team sports are the best method to teach youngsters how to cooperate is a viewpoint that has gained considerable attention. Although team sports can indeed foster collaboration skills, I believe that there are other effective avenues for teaching cooperation as well.

Essentially, team sports are very efficient when it comes to teaching young people how to cooperate with each other. Through a competitive environment, teenagers develop teamwork skills, self-esteem and strategising. For example, students can have many opportunities to recognise the strengths as well as the shortcomings of each teammate which can be used to better compete against their opponents, especially in sports with more than 5 participants such as football, volleyball and basketball. Additionally, playing sports also stimulates a working environment where people work towards a common goal together. Thus, pupils learn how to work together more effectively when they engage in these sporting activities.

On the other hand, it is important to recognize that cooperation skills can be cultivated through a range of activities beyond team sports. Firstly, cooperative learning strategies in classrooms, group projects, community service activities and even creative pursuits like theatre or music can also provide valuable opportunities for young adults to develop collaboration skills. In fact, these activities promote cooperation, and the ability to work effectively in a group setting. They encourage the youth to understand diverse perspectives, value teamwork and appreciate the benefit of collective effort. Secondly, not all offspring may be inclined toward or have the opportunity to participate in team sports. Thus, it is essential to provide a range of activities and environments that cater to diverse interests or abilities, ensuring that all youngsters have a chance to develop their cooperation skills.

In conclusion, while team sports offer valuable opportunities for teaching offspring to cooperate, I believe that cooperation skills can be developed through a variety of activities and environments. By providing a balanced approach that includes all activities, we can effectively nurture the value and skill of cooperation in adolescents.

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school, to what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
People have different views about the best way to cultivate children's collaborative spirit. Although doing team sports is one of the efficient ways to achieve that, I believe teachers can find better solutions than this method.

On the one hand, team sports demand students to work closely and communicate frequently, which will improve children's cooperative skills. During this process, they will realize that everyone is born with strengths and shortcomings and only by working together can they have a competitive edge in the future. Also, doing team sports brings students more happiness than individual sports and help them to make new friends, which may motivate them to cooperate with others in the future.

On the other hand, other methods, such as working in groups to solve a practical problem, are also efficient to boost students' collaborative spirit. For example, there are a wide variety of interdisciplinary programs in many schools, which need the contribution of team members that are good at different subjects. Without joint effort, children will never be able to come to a satisfying solution. As a result, they will realize how important it is to cooperate with and learn from each other. Meanwhile, students working in these joint projects will also find it helpful to work together because it can enhance their problem-solving skills and boost their knowledge in all the subjects that are used. 

In conclusion, although taking team sports works well in teaching children the importance of cooperation, I think there are better ways that teachers can come up with to encourage their students to work with joint force.

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
A sport is a form of activity that incorporates physical and mental skills to create a genre of entertainment which is commonly done as a team. Because of the impact it has on the mind and body, playing a team sport is a good way to teach children life skills such as cooperation. 

As a child, it is difficult to sit in class and concentrate while having an excessive amount of energy. This is why allowing them to participate in a sport as part of their curriculum is crucial. The feeling of synergy when being with friends, in the outdoors and running around as much as possible is indescribable. They are using up all their energy without even thinking about it while exercising and becoming fit. By the time they are in class, they are ready to concentrate. This is one reason as to how sports allows children to cooperate in a school setting.  

Furthermore, there would be a set of rules that a team needs to abide by so that they are able to win. If the chosen sport is football, each position would have to communicate on when to pass the ball, work with each other as a team to identify the strengths but also follow the rules. If at any point the rules are not followed, a yellow or red card would be given. This shows that there are consequences if restrictions are not abided by. The children would be learning about teamwork, communication and cooperation while simultaneously having fun.

Team sports are beneficial when it comes to teaching the younger generation. It is a great educational tool that provides life skills, fitness and fun times all at once. Because of this, it is the best way to teach children about life skills like cooperation.

prompt: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Team sports usually promote good values for the community. Some people say that children should learn to cooperate by practising this kind of sport at school. My opinion, I strongly agree that teaching cooperation through team sports would be the best way for pupils to incorporate this attitude into their lives. 

Nowadays, soccer, rugby, hockey and volleyball are incredibly famous around the globe and kids know them very well as they watch them on the TV and even practise them in sports centres but also at school. In particular, physical education teachers always try to introduce the students to the beautiful world of  cooperative activities by explaining the rules of each sport and then letting them practise in the field. For example, in  practice, they need to organise into two teams and play soccer when they have to pass the ball to score, they need to trust and know each other in order to improvise with the ball. It is a fact that children adore playing and doing exercise, so why not use it to help them to improve their collaborative skills?

In addition to this, teachers can motivate children to compete in regional tournaments where they need to strengthen their relationships to create a strong group and to improve human values like cooperation and respect. For instance, in the school where I used to work, every year was a great competition in which all the students from all levels used to participate. Teamwork through different activities and sports was implemented, and even the families were involved in organising meals and supporting their children. There is no doubt that the kids were highly motivated and really enjoyed the tournament.

In conclusion, teaching sports at school, where pupils can learn how to organise themselves in the field like a team and get motivated to participate in scholar competitions would contribute to making a huge change in their attitude and the manner in which they interact with each other. Sports may not be the only way to teach this, but it is by far the most practical way to teach the young to act cooperatively in their community.

essay:

Although, others believe that government should combat malnutrition in the country, having a good health should be more concerning to the citizens. 

It is said to believe that government should should ensure that the people are having enough food to avoid hunger. They are responsible in monitoring the amount of stocks available in the country and should subsidize the value for the benefit of the citizens. For instance, the food and drug administration is the agency that protects and ensure the rights to health of the Filipinos and resulted in decrease number of malnutrition in the nation. However, I believe that an individual should be responsible in maintaining a good health.

On the other hand, having a healthy body is a personal choice. People should be more optimistic in looking for one's welfare and not relying in the government. Having a good health is crucial to avoid straining the government's budget for the budget should be allotted in more important projects such as road infrastracture and providing jobs to people. For example, eating a balance diet and exrecises are one of the many ways on improving health. 

In conclusion, public health is something should be address nowadays. Although, others believe that government should promote health to every mankind. I believe that people should be more concern with their own body to achieve a good health. As the saying says "Health is Wealth".

However, the others advocate that taking vitamins and food is completely individual choice. In this essay, I will discuss on both perspectives and will put my own viewpoint at the end of the essay.

On the one hand, some group of people strongly believes that the government should be responsible for formulating laws on public health. This is because people are paying taxes to the government from their regular income. For example, the government collects its revenue from the taxes of its citizens so the government has to act on voicing for people’s health. Thus, some set of individuals emphasize on the responsibility of health ministry on advancing legal laws on public health.

On the other hand, some second on the sole responsibility of government in developing laws for health of its native. They state that the wellbeing is completely a personal choice and dependent on individual’s right to be fit and healthy. For instance, some trusts that the different food habits and supplements work differently on each individual’s body. Furthermore, same provisions on health laws may not create the same benefit to all individual because each individual has different body type and have need different preferences on food. 

In conclusion, some agrees that government should be made accountable for legalizing health laws whereas some disagrees and believes that health is an individual preference. In my view, though health is a personal choice but it should be legalized and constantly monitored from the government also to create equal health benefits for all people.

prompt:
Some people think that public health within a country can be improved by government making laws regarding nutritious food. Others, however, think that health is a matter of personal choice and responsibility. 


Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Globalisation and Industrialization has impacted working and eating habits of almost everyone residing in Tier 1 or Tier 2 cities. Fast food chains and QSR restaurants have emerged as a go-to place for people in corporate jobs due to high workload. Public health in general, depends majorly on these two factors. This essay will discuss both aspects of government intervention in regulating availability of different eating options in order to improve general health in the country. 

 Although eating habits are unique in every region, religion and even generation, there is one similarity, which is need of nutrition for our body to maintain immune system and ability to perform the required tasks. Depending of various job types, different diet patterns are more appropriate for different people, and accordingly humans have developed their eating habits around it. This directly affects the health which, albeit gradually, improves overtime if we consume nutritious food; and remain physically active throughout the day.

I strongly advocate that maintaining overall health should be the responsibility of oneself in general. However, authorities should ensure that private companies are not overburdening their employees to perform more than what their job entails. Regulating nutritious food entirely may result in favouritism and undue inclination towards one industry, hampering the level playing field for various businesses. 

Partial involvement of government in releasing the minimum nutritional requirement for people, enabling transparency on the ingredients used in food items being sold in outlets or supermarkets, guidance on leading a healthy lifestyle will always ascertain the good of their citizens.

prompt: Some people think that public health within a country can be improved by government making laws regarding nutritious food. Others, however, think that health is a matter of personal choice and responsibility. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Many people believe that the level of health and hygiene can improve only by the government`s monitoring such as imposing some policies related to food supply; however, others are in this opinion that personal decision and responsibility have played a vital role in this subject. In my perspective, both the government`s legislation and personal care, are necessary.

On the one hand, one of the important causes of health problems is the food which people consume. If governments legislate various laws related to this issue the level of problems, which people face during their life, will increase, and life expectancy will be extended. Moreover, by improving the agricultural techniques, the mortality reduction emerges that is because better nutrition will be shared among people. To illustrate, If urban centres start to deliver clean water and remove waste, the dramatic reduction in water and nutrition will be occurring, general personal hygiene grows. So, governments can be a crucial aid for declining in mortality rate and rising in health level.

On the other hand, people were given advice about what are the causes of disease and how they can prevent infectious disease by caring about personal health, so what they need is to pay attention on little easy subjects such as watching their hand, do not use others brush, and visiting a doctor in every specific period to check up. Furthermore, sports have been one of the necessary fields that decrease the risk of being sick, so provided that one has a regular daily exercise, they will not face difficulty especially when they become old. Thus, without personal-care, public health will not develop.

To conclude, it is obvious that states are vital aspects to promote health-related items as well as self-attention. In my notion, both self-care and the state-care about the aspects which affect health are equally important, and these hygiene improvements can be more effective if both groups cooperate.

prompt: Some people think that public health of a country can be improved if the government make laws regarding nutritious food but others think that it is the matter of personal choice and personal responsibility. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Nowadays, healthcare condition is becoming more and more essential to each individual. Some people argue that the government should take measures to improve health of their citizens by imposing food laws. Others believe that everyone has responsible for their own health. This essay will discuss both points of view before coming to a reasoned conclusion.

On the one hand, in fact governments play a critical role to ensure well-being of their citizens. First of all, governments are responsible for the quality and safety of food in the market, they could introduce strict laws to make sure that public heath will not be damaged by polluted or expired food. Moreover, using unauthorized chemicals, selling unhygienic and low-quality food should be forbidden by the government. For example, eating fast food may lead to severe diseases such as increase in blood cholesterol, raise blood pressure and obesity. In some countries, the government imposes a high tax on junk food with the objective of discouraging its consumption. All of these are measures that can have a positive impact on public health.

On the other hand, in my opinion healthy lifestyle is a choice and habit of an individual, each person should hold accountable for their health, and the government cannot monitor the lifestyle of every citizen.  For instance, if people follow a sedentary lifestyle such as eating junk food, being a potato couch, being ignorant to break their bad habit and so on, they will surely suffer from physical health issues. However, the government cannot do much to help these people. Furthermore, the choices of individuals greatly affect the overall health condition of a nation. Thus, each person should choose more suitable food according to their own physical conditions, and retain a kind of good eating habit for long term so as to have a healthier lifestyle.

In shorts, there are several reasons for health problem, and I strongly believe that both governments and individuals should join hands to improve the situation.

prompt:
Some people believe that the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers instead of benefitting them individually.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There is belief that says "The main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers instead of benefitting them individually". I mostly agree to this statement. A school teachs not only an academic lesson but also a social lesson to correct students' conduct. Moreover almost all school have similar lessons, so students will grow up to be same good adults. But maybe there are some places that are not similar to others.

First of all, In every school, they teach general academic subjects such as Math, Science, English and etc. In addition to these subjects, there are lessons intented to make the students become responsible citizens of the society. For example, social studies or law studies that teach students what they should and should not do. And that they will recieve punishment if they do something wrong. Also, when students spending their time in schools, they will learn how to behave and interact with each other. School disciplinary is also the way to guide children to the good path.

Furthermore, because every school have the same standard for the graduated students. Their curriculums tend to be the same. And that has a negative effect on the student. Because everyone has his own talent. Teaching students the same thing doesn't mean that thay will get equal score. To illustrate, when someone who's good at drawing and someone who's good at Math study Algebra together, he who excels at Math will do better. But, does this mean that students who get bad grades are bad student? No, they may be bad at Math but they have something they good at too. Unfortunately that their capabilities have to be measured with an only same standard.

However, some schools may not be like the others. There are a few schools whose intent are not just to bring up their student to be good people but encourage them to be the best version of themself. These schools still have the same requirement for their students to meet. but they support things that are not in the requirement too. To give examples, some schools permit students to join clubs of their interests after studying periods, such as, art club, music club and sports club. Furthermore, these schools curriculum may not limit to just science course and social studies course. They have other course like literature, management and art course too.

To sum it up, every school have similar ways of teaching and preparing their students to become good citizens and workers of the societies. Yet, they teach the same things to every students , despite the fact that everyone is unique and has his own way of learning. Therefore, you could say that this way of teaching doesn't benefit their students individually. That's why i agree with this statement. However, there might be some schools that do it differently. While keeping the standards like other schools, they support their students individually too. For their intentions that students will grow up not only to be good citizens, but also to be themself that they dream of.

For this reason, academies ought to assist in finding student's talents, and it will benefit our communities.

In conclusion, I partially agree with this statement. Schools must teach their pupils to turn into good citizens and workers and also help them find abilities because it is essential. So, we must teach them to balance, and that will be good not only for the young public but also for our societies.

prompt: Some people think the main purpose of schools is to turn the children into good citizens and workers rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree
essay:
In contemporary society, the primary purpose of schooling has been under heated debate. Many people hold the view that transforming students into good citizens and workers is the fundamental goal of education rather than concentrating on individual betterment. From my perspective, I agree with the given sentiment and this course of the essay will elaborate carefully to provide the reasons for my personal opinion.

First and foremost, it is likely universal that a good individual should be useful to certain communities. It means that a well-skilled person might not be defined as a good one if those harms or are unsupportive to society. Therefore, schools in which children's perspectives could be changed officially and openly should mainly focus on educating moral lessons and qualifies alongside particular subjects or skills. Being community-minded, for example, seem to be a necessary characteristic which is needed to be taught by school education, especially in fast-paced life in which there is likely sympathy insufficient. In a nutshell, a community could not be prosperous unless every single citizen is dedicated to bigger purposes.

However, it is indicated that generally moral lessons are unlikely the only target of schooling since the development of societies relies significantly on single and personal innovations. specifically, Throughout the countless year of humankind's life, there was numerous innovative inventions and explorations that were undertaken by genius brains that have been changing human life totally and positively such as America's exploration and invention of the internet and computers, or chronic disease treatments. Therefore, alongside the primary goal, seeking and nurturing individual talents should be taken into consideration in order to create a quality workforce for our community.  Seeking talent shows, for example, specific courses, and modern facilities should be provided free for children when they are still in school seats.

In conclusion, in spite of individualism development in contemporary society schools should play the main role in educating the young generation to turn out useful and well-educated people in their community. Besides, increasing personal betterment is not likely less crucial, however, it does not seem the major purpose of education.

In conclusion, there are several objectives for the school however the most important one is teaching junior to be  good people in the forthcoming. prompt: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving school and unable to find jobs after graduation. What problems do you think youth unemployment will cause to the individual and society? Make some suggestions to solve the problem.
essay:
Our modern world nowadays faces many challenges, One of the most important one is Unemployment among young people. In many countries, People have problems  finding jobs after their graduation. In this essay, we will discuss the reasons behind this problem, and what are the best solutions to ease it.

Our society finds unemployment a serious issue and plays a major impact on individuals and the community. with regard to the impact on the individual, A person can not generate money without a job, So jobless people will burden their own families because they have to work harder to cover the expenses of their children, instead of enjoying their old age. Moreover, pupils are not able to grasp social and learning skills without a career. Also, unemployment has a negative influence on  society by making people stressed, and frustrated, and as a result of this, People might do illegal things such as becoming drug addicts and joining gangs.

There are many suggestions to solve this problem, Firstly, governments can build industries to broaden their career horizon. In addition to the previously mentioned point, The government should add social lessons to the school's curriculum so they can assist the students to develop their career skills. Secondary , making vocational training  a part of the graduation mission can help them learn academic subjects and earn money at the same time. As a final point, the government should promote local job centres. The activities of these centres should be organized, so the students can easily access job information.

in summary, unemployment is a massive subject, As might lead to serious problems for society and individuals, Such as joining gangs and making people frustrated. so, the government should look for the resolutions like building companies and developing job centres.

prompt: In many countries, more and more young people are leaving school and unable to find jobs after graduation. What problems do you think youth unemployment will cause to the individual and society? Make some suggestions to solve the problem.
essay:
Unemployment among young people is an ongoing and increasing situation in many countries around the world. The fact that students cannot find jobs after graduation is the cause of certain complications and can be addressed/solved/tackled/resolved using several methods .

To begin with, there are a huge number of issues related to young jobless people on a personal as well as community level. Firstly, in terms of finance, young people cannot generate income unless they have a career. Becoming financially dependent, they can face a lot of difficulties in maintaining their daily life. Also, they may become a burden to their own family, especially their parents who have to work harder and harder to cover their expenses instead of enjoying old age. Moreover, workless people are one of the reasons that make social evils more serious. A person without a job usually spends most of the time doing nothing, which makes it easy for them to engage in wrongdoing such as robbery, theft, and drug addiction. 

To minimize and partially solve this problem,  education for the younger generations as well as government action are the most important. First of all, schools should equip students with practical skills and organize career orientation sessions for students. By doing this, it can be easier for them to find jobs after graduation. Also, motivating and encouraging students to participate in vocational training after leaving school for both studying and earning an income can help ease the problem. Furthermore, the government should promote the operation of local career and job placement centres. The activities of these centres should be propagated so that young people can easily access more job information.

In conclusion, unemployment among young people today is a serious situation and affects both themselves and society as a whole, but this can be tackled with proper education from schools and assistance from the government.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:** 
- The essay adequately addresses the task by identifying the problems caused by youth unemployment on both the individual and societal levels.
- It provides clear and coherent ideas, although some aspects could have been elaborated upon further to fully cover all parts of the task.
- The arguments are supported with examples, but they could have been more specific and expanded upon to strengthen the response.

prompt: Some believe that people are naturally born leaders while others feel that leadership skills can develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
There is a tremendously controversial prospective heating up a debate the origin of the leadership. While some people hold a strong view that it is a natural skill, the opposites make a statement that a person can become a leader through the experience as well as the knowledge. This essay will discuss both point of view and my personal opinion about this phenomenon

Evidently, a wealth of people are naturally born leaders since they own the strong characteristics to become a leader such as being outgoing person, gregarious and full of energy. All these personality traits help the leader to manage, to gather people together and to inspire and motivate them. Vladimir Putin, a president of Russia can be cited as an outstanding example that he natural born political leader who inspires many people with his boundless professional abilities, charisma and display astounding skills. Hence, being sociable, charisma and having strong traits are important natural skills for being a chief.

Although the leadership skill is one of natural skills, I still belive that it can be built and enhanced.  There are a bunch of elements that make someone a great leader, such as discipline and resourcefulness, which can definitely be developed through one's upbringing and life period. For instance, to become a pioneer as well as a president of Vietnam, Hochiminh had to spent three decades in this life on travelling around the world and  acquire the knowledge from developed nations in this time to find an ideal way to lead our country. Therefore, beside a natural skill, leadership can be developed by the experience in life. 

In conclusion, although a strong leader's talents and traits are both genetic and can be improved by training, observation, and a lot of hard work, there are many people born without natural leadership skills who can still become good leaders thank to their attemption.

prompt: Every day, millions of tons of food are wasted all over the world. Why do you think this is happening? And how can we solve this problem?
essay:
Nowadays, to serve a billion people each day we need a huge of food and sometimes people can consume it. In the following essay, I discuss some of reason why people do it and how to solve that problem. 

There are a hundred of reasons why a large amount of food is wasted every year. First, since most fresh foods, such as meat and vegetables, are perishable, they usually have expired or best before dates. This means that if people do not consume them quickly enough, 

foods will be expired and no longer to use, which results in food waste.

Second, the way humans prepare foods also contributes to food waste. 

For example, if foods are badly prepared, either at home or in the restaurant, people will confuse to eat and food waste will often occur as a result. 

Nevertheless, there are also a variety of solutions to improve this trend. 

First, even if some foods are not use for humans, they can be composted or used to feed livestock or animals. This would not only benefit the agriculture industry but also help reduce land filled organic matter that can be damaging to the environment. 

Second, even if the food waste is not use for livestock, it can still be used as a material to produce renewable energy. For example, in Singapore and some develop nations have taken steps to turn organic matter from food waste into biogas, generating electrical power at very low costs. 

In conclusion, even though food waste seems not harmless in today’s world, there are various ways to recycle it. Feeding livestock and generate energy can be two of the most useful ways to tackle food waste.

prompt: Every day, millions of tons of food are wasted all over the world. Why do you think this is happening? And how can we solve this problem?
essay:
There has been an ever-increasing trend that people discard an excessive amount of food waste from all corners of the world. Although this problem can be attributed to a great number of reasons, some feasible solutions can be considered to address this.

There are a number of reasons for this adverse tendency. The first reason for the rise in the amount of food waste is the increased supply of cheap and readily available food, which encourages people to buy more than they really need. For example, in order to increase sale revenue as well as compete with other brands, many fast-food restaurants nowadays have launched plenty of promotion programs such as “By 2 get 1 free”, which has attracted hundreds of customers and thus the huge amount of food waste will end up in landfills. Another reason is that in order to deal with busy lifestyles, people tend to buy food for the whole week rather than go to the supermarket on a daily basis. However, some kinds of fruits and vegetables easily become rotten within a few days and then thrown away.

A wide range of strong measures must be implemented, not only by the government but also by individuals, to combat food waste. This first solution is that the government can develop some action plans to raise consumers’ awareness of food appreciation. This could be done by getting people involved in global food campaigns such as Think.Eat.Save and anti-food waste campaign, helping their citizens to become more conscious consumers and when everyone is fully aware of this, they would think more carefully when it comes to shopping for food. In terms of each consumer, it is important to make a detailed shopping list before going to the supermarket. This way helps them to have time to prepare and decide wisely what products should be bought, which eventually saves a lot of unnecessary food.

In conclusion, Although food waste seems inevitable in today’s world, there are various ways to improve this problem.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has adequately addressed the task prompt by providing reasons for food waste and proposing solutions.

prompt:
Some people think the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel.

To what extend do you agree or disagree

?
essay:
Global environmental changes are unquestionably the most prevalent and worrying issues in any society, and their prevention should be taken seriously. Despite a few problems, such as plastic production and the absence of recycling, I reckon that the decision of the raising prices for fuel is definitely the best way to prevent the worldwide catastrophe.

On one hand, the main environmental issue of global warming is caused by two significant factors, which are burning fossil fuels and deforestation. Firstly, expensive fuel could actually decrease a number of cars bought by people due to the fact of economic purposes. As a consequence, people would have a lower level of horrible emissions, which are produced by cars. Secondly, if the amount of vehicles is stable, hundreds of new roads would not be needed, and more forests and parks could be saved. Therefore, the greenhouse effect, caused by transport pollution, could be managed by the natural process of carbon dioxide absorption.

On the other hand, there are still a few factors, which could not be removed by changing a price tag. It is known that plastic has not been already replaced by other materials, so its production could not be immediately restricted. Moreover, most people are not used to recycling various types of waste, consequently, tons of rubbish are supposed to threaten the surrounding area. Therefore, hundreds of humans consider fuel price raising to be an inappropriate solution.

To conclude, despite varying opinions, I believe that the advantages of increasing the cost of fuel completely outweigh the relative disadvantages. Without a doubt, this solution would be the first useful step, which government should take in order to protect the environment.

- The candidate has addressed the given task by providing a clear stance on the issue and discussing both sides of the argument.

Some individuals believe that the most effective way to deal with worldwide ecological difficulties is to raise the price of fuel. However, I am of the opinion that it will benefit the society to some extent only, which will be discussed in the following paragraphs.
Increase in price of fuel will limit the personal transport of an individual to some levels and commuters will find other alternatives to travel on daily basic such as public transport or electric vehicles. Majorly the middle class families will be effected with this step and persuade them to follow local city transport in the sake of controlling pollution. Recently, in Delhi, the government took initiatives to control the personal vehicle on road by charging double amount on petrol purchase for own carriers, thus the output was quite effective and number of vehicles drop down approximately 80 percent from the service roads. 
However, on the other hand, the major contributors of air pollution are the airplanes. In that case lowering the price will not impact much as air travelling is carried by mostly rich people and it is part of luxury. People who prefer travelling by air as compare to road are always keeping the time limit as priority instead of money. Hence, increasing price will not lower the usage of air transport. Thus, we need to look for an alternative solution to minimize the pollution hazard. 
In conclusion, increasing price of fuel will profit the community in terms of limiting usage of personal conveyance, but for some who choose time as the limit instead of money will not be effected with this idea. Consequently, I believe inflation in price will not resolve the ecological problems.

prompt: Some people think that illegal Internet downloads are having a negative effect on the music industry. Others feel that they have little or no impact on artists. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
The music industry has changed vastly since the golden days of Beethoven and Mozart. With the rapid growth of the internet and smartphones, listening to music has become easier than ever. Instead of having to attend concerts, listeners can just plug their headphones into a smartphone and listen to music online. While this has its fair share of benefits, record labels have been hesitant to expand into the online music industry since it has various drawbacks, including piracy issues and monetization. In this essay, I will discuss the aforementioned issues as well as giving my own opinion.

On one hand, the explosive growth of online music websites has made it exponentially harder for record labels and artists to control and monetize their work. These people are concerned that as the internet music industry grows, so do the piracy issues. This may cause everyone to copy each other, making music seem unoriginal and uninterested. It can also discourage artists to produce and release music, as there are no ways for them to ensure that their music is being used as they intended as well as controlling where their works are being published. Overall, illegal Internet downloads can have negative effects on the artists and the music industry as a whole.

On the other hand, having the ability to publish music on the internet - where millions of users are actively using and discussing every day - has helped new artists get discovered and grow. Moreover, the growth of music piracy has pushed streaming platforms to take extra steps to prevent illegal downloads. It's not hard to understand why in the early 2000s, record labels and artists were trying to take down music streaming platforms that were allowing users to download music freely and distribute it wherever they please. The most notable case of this is perhaps Napster, as this platform was taken down after a huge wave of protests to protect the rights of composers. Because of this, most streaming platforms like Spotify and Apple Music include features that help artists control their music distribution and monetization. Therefore, it's almost impossible to pirate music now, unlike in the 2000s. 

To summarize, illegal Internet downloads can and have caused a ton of issues regarding piracy and monetization, but they helped push the development of tools to ensure these issues never happen again. Therefore, it's safe to say that illegal downloads aren't an issue in the modern world.
evaluation:

prompt: Nowadays, we are surround by advertising in our daily lives. Some people believe this has a positive effect on society. Others, however, say that it is a negative development. Discuss with both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Advertisements have been part of our daily activities for a long period of time now. There are those who believe that its benefits outweigh its drawbacks and vice versa. I, on the other hand, believe that there is more harm than good that these advertisements bring.

 

Due to advertisements, we are able to be updated about upgraded products and trends that will surely make our lives easier. For instance, high-end cell phones and devices have been flooding the market and have shown different upgraded specifications and functions. Through advertisements, we are also being offered  the best deals like huge discounts and markdowns on once popular products. Advertisements have been constantly reminding us to check out the latest trends and upgrades. 

Nonetheless, advertisements seem to have become more intrusive nowadays. The means resorted to catching the attention of consumers are barely filtered out already. On the internet, for example, advertisements have been popping up more often that  instantly distract the viewer from browsing the actual content he or she wishes to see. Another instance is paper flyers that have ended up being scattered anywhere in the streets and thus become garbage polluting the surroundings. Every nook and cranny is now covered with sorts of advertisements and has destroyed beautiful scenery. 

In conclusion, advertisements can be helpful in keeping us up to date with the latest improvements that will make our lives easier. However, due to unregulated postings, advertisements may have become more of a nuisance and distraction.

prompt: Some people think that increasing business and cultural contacts worldwide have positive influences on development; others think that they have negative effects on national identities. Discuss both views and give your own opinion."
essay:
In the globalized society, the issue of increasing business and cultural communication worldwide has sparked considerable debate. Some contend that exposure to the culture of other countries too much will greatly negatively affect the acknowledgement of domestic history and culture. I strongly agree that increasing communication among countries fosters development both in personal and professional settings. 

Opponents show concern about the fade of national identity by exposure to increasing cultural connections as the history and culture of the native country tend to be easily forgotten by the invasion of the exterior culture. For example, along with the increasing exposure to Western culture, most young adults are more likely to celebrate Christmas instead of some Chinese traditional festival since some young people are obsessed with the unknown culture. They might know the origin of Santa but they have no idea of the origin of the Dragon festival.

Proponents, as I am in favour of, hold the view that emphasizing  communication worldwide positively cultivates  development at individual, enterprise and country levels. At the individual level, worldwide information exchange and multiple languages communication improve the ability of critical thinking and academic learning. At the enterprise level, the popular trend of international trade and international companies provide more employment opportunities domestically. Moreover, the GDP of one country will also be fostered by increasing economic benefits of importation and exportation. Moreover, while young people are attracted to other cultures, the root cause is the lack of propaganda of their conventional culture and civilization. Under positive public guidance, such cultural erosion will be mitigated to some extent. 

In conclusion, while increasing communication in business and cultural settings has some negative effects on the acknowledgement of national identity so far, the positive effect outperforms its drawbacks by improving the personal and country development under correct guidance.

prompt: The range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has an opposite effect. Discuss both view and give your opinions.
essay:
In today’s world, the impact of technology on income inequality is a topic of intense debate. Some believe it widens the wealth gap, while others argue it can bridge it. This essay explores both viewpoints to assess the complex relationship between technology and socioeconomic disparities.

On the one hand, technology can amplify the wealth gap as affluent individuals and well-funded corporations can employ automation and artificial intelligence in the workplace. This allows them to reduce labor costs, leading to job displacement and wage stagnation for the working class. For instance, in manufacturing, advanced robotics and automation can replace human workers, leading to job loss and downward pressure on wages, while the companies get the benefits of cost savings and increased profits. This automation-driven wealth accumulation can leave many individuals and communities struggling to keep up economically.

On the other hand, technology can be a powerful tool in reducing income disparities. The digital revolution has made information and education more accessible. The advent of e-learning platforms and open-source educational resources allows individuals from economically disadvantaged backgrounds to acquire valuable skills, enhancing their employability. Additionally, technology facilitates innovative solutions to societal issues, exemplified by telemedicine, which provides cost-effective healthcare options to underserved communities, effectively bridging the healthcare disparity. The widespread use of smartphones has also created opportunities for micro-entrepreneurship and access to financial services, empowering individuals to improve their economic well-being.

In conclusion, the impact of technology on the wealth gap is a complex and multifaceted issue. Its potential to either widen or narrow the wealth gap depends on how we approach its development and distribution, emphasizing access, education, and opportunities for all.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement:
- The candidate has fully addressed the task by discussing both viewpoints on the impact of technology on income inequality and providing specific examples to support their arguments.
- The response is clear and coherent, with the candidate presenting their ideas in a logical and organized manner.
- Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 8

### Coherence and Cohesion:
- The essay is well-organized, with clear transitions between paragraphs.
- The candidate uses appropriate linking devices to connect ideas and paragraphs, creating a smooth flow of information.
- Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 8

### Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, including specific terms related to technology and economics.
- There are no significant vocabulary errors.
- However, the candidate could use more varied vocabulary to avoid repetition, such as using "automation" instead of "advanced robotics and automation."
- Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 7

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
- The candidate uses a variety of sentence structures, demonstrating grammatical range.
- There are no major grammatical errors, but there are a few minor errors in sentence construction, such as "the companies get the benefits of cost savings and increased profits" could be "companies benefit from cost savings and increased profits."
- The candidate uses punctuation correctly.
- Suggested Band Score (Grammatical Range and Accuracy): 7

### Overall Band Score:
- The essay meets the requirements of the task and demonstrates good overall performance in terms of task achievement, coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, and grammatical range and accuracy.

### Feedback and Additional Comments:
**Strengths:**

prompt: Some people believe that climate has the greatest affect on people's way of life. Others believe that the economy of a region has the greatest effect. This is both the views and give your opinion.
essay:
Some argue that climate is the main factor determining people's way of life, while others think the economy of a region is the most important. I agree with both suggestions and I will explain afterwards with my opinion.

On the one hand, climate is a strong power that changes many parts of our lives. It decides what we can grow, what animals we can grow, and how much water we have. The climate also affects the kind of clothes and houses we need. For example, the public in hot, sunny places lives differently from those in cold areas. Where it rains a lot, society often relies on farming, whereas in dry places, they might depend on things like tourism for money.

On the other hand, the economy in a place really changes how people live. In areas with lots of money, pupils can get better schooling, healthcare, and jobs. A strong economy creates more progress better buildings, more jobs, and a higher standard of living. For instance, in cities with a strong economy, you'll find new buildings, lots of job options, and a good way of life.

In my opinion, both the climate and the economy have a big role in how people live. Climate can decide what you can grow or raise, but the economy gives us the money and chances to live well. In places with a strong economy, people can bring food from other places or use technology to handle climate challenges.

In conclusion, both climate and the economy matter a lot. Climate affects what is possible, but the economy gives us what we need to live well. The balance between these two things decides how good life is in a place.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

- The candidate has addressed the given task by presenting a balanced opinion on the influence of both climate and economy on people's way of life.
- The response is fairly clear and coherent, but it could benefit from more detailed explanations and specific examples.
- The candidate has covered all parts of the task, providing arguments to support both sides. However, some of the arguments could be developed further.
- **Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6**

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

- The essay is organized into three paragraphs, with each paragraph focusing on a different aspect of the topic.
- The use of linking devices is limited, which affects the overall flow of ideas.

prompt: Films and computer games containing violence are popular. Some people say they have negative effects on society and should be banned. Others say they are just harmless relaxation. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is a reality that violent movies and video games are becoming prevalent in modern society. While some contend that it has detrimental effects on people and society and ought to be outlawed, others think that these activities are simply good ways to unwind. I concur with these points of view and will talk about them in this post.

On the one hand, youngsters often mimic violent behavior they see in movies or video games, which is one of the main reasons why they have a negative impact on society. For instance, children are drawn to the dramatic violence and interest in these violent video games, particularly Counterstrike, and desire to practice their actions in real life. The second explanation is that youngsters are more likely to develop a gaming addiction. Children are consequently too lethargic to engage in outside activities and would develop obesity.

On the other hand, the benefits of movies and video games for society come from the fact that kids can refuel after watching or playing them. For instance, many individuals unwind by watching esport tournaments, which are developed annually with the aim of entertaining people and promoting video games worldwide. Additionally, these violent movies and activities, particularly the games, may aid in the development of new friendships for the children as well as enhance cognitive plasticity.

In conclusion, even while violent movies and video games are bad for society, they can also be helpful for youngsters in terms of useful relaxation.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for humankind's future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In this age of technocracy, among many wonderous inventions, robots have proven to be the most promising of them all. Many deem it to be a worthy addition to our lives, but contrarians to this notion believe that, it can prove detrimental to our society. In this essay, I will ruminate on both sides, before making my statement.

Those  who consider robotics to be vital for the advancement of civilization, do so by observing several quality-of-life changes brought by it. Such as, the integration of rudimentary assembly line machines used for product manufacturing. Moreover, there exist self-driving cars, waiting to revolutionize methods of transportation. Additionally, there have been major strides in the development of life-like androids. All in all, the future seems bright indeed according to these supporters.

However, trepidatious ones vouching against this technological progress, do so by witnessing drawbacks brought by these gizmos. Like, mass lay-offs caused by the introduction of automatic tools in many factories around the world. Furthermore, these people do not look favourably at the idea of automation in vehicles, as they are wary of hazards associated with it. Also, they hold fast to the belief that, there will come a day when automatons will completely render human talent superficial. As an example, the advent of artificial intelligence art (AI art) has filled artists around the globe with dread, as they think that they will soon be replaced by their man-made counterparts.

To conclude, In my opinion, both views of this argument possess merit. Thus, to ensure a better tomorrow, moderation must be made in terms of the development of bots.

prompt: Some people think that the range of technology available to people is increasing the gap between the rich and the poor. Others think it has the opposite effect. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
While there is an increasing concern that technological advances increase the gap between the affluent and the poor people, some people argue that technological change narrow this gap. This essay would discuss both perspectives as well as state my opinion for the former one.

On the one hand, technology exacerbates between the wealthy and the poor. Technological advancements might lead to job replacements in some current areas. The demand for highly-skill workers in some fields such as artificial intelligence or data analysis increase whilst lower-skilled jobs may see reduced demand. As a result, people who do monotonous and repetitive jobs will lose their jobs and result in income inequalities. Furthermore, the limited access to technology among the disadvantaged hinder them from benefiting technological advancements. Many technological products are prohibitively expensive and only the rich can afford to buy them. 

On the other hand, proponents of the opposing view contend that technological advancements are reducing income inequality. Technological change enables all individuals, irrespective socioeconomic background, to access education and services with affordable price. Consequently, the poor also have a better chance of landing a high-paid job, leading to increased income and a higher living of standard. In addition, technological advances increase productivity in wide range of fields. This might lead to the demand for job in many industrial zones increase and the poor can improve their income. 

In conclusion, certain innovations in technology might bridge the gap between the rich and the poor, while certain developments help us to narrow down this gap and make our lives better.

prompt: Some people think that robots are important for human’s future development. Others think that robots have negative effects on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
In recent times, the development in the field of robotics has increased rapidly and its prevalence can be noticed in many places. Many believe robots are crucial for human development whereas some argue they have a negative effect on society. This essay would discuss both  views with empirical evidence and conclude with my opinion.

To begin with, artificial intelligence is one of the greatest milestones achieved by humans. They can be used to study places which are inaccessible to humans. For instance, the world-renowned rover Curiosity, was sent to Mars for a detailed analysis of the planet's features. Without robotic technology, it would take another decade to achieve this feat. Hence, this technology plays a vital role in the development of mankind.

On the other hand, robotic machines have replaced men in many jobs. For instance, in many food and packaging industries, programmed machines are used as they are more efficient and fast when compared to a worker. Furthermore, a robot can work for long hours without any breaks, thus increasing in productivity of a company. This scenario can lead to an increase in the unemployment rate causing a detrimental effect on  society.

To sum it up, robots have a pivotal role in  future development and the need for them is inevitable. Although this development has a downside, considering the future technological advancement, robotic science and technology are essential to achieve it.

prompt: Some people say that playing computer games is bad for children in every aspects. Others say that playing computer games can have positive effects on the way children develop. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
While some people believe that playing computer games is detrimental for children, others claim that it has some benefits in terms of their development. In my opinion, playing computer games should be considered  positive for children’s development as individuals.

On the one hand, it is obvious that spending a lot of time in front of the screen and playing computer games can bring lots of problems for children’s health, especially their vision. When kids play video games being slumped in front of the screen for hours, it definitely makes their eyes dry and, therefore, destroys the protection layer. Furthermore, in some cases, young people will face other severe issues connected with losing their vision clearness, so at the end of the day, they will have to wear glasses in order to correct their vision and see the objects around them clearly. Another key problem that could be brought about by playing computer games is addiction. Children do not have highly developed brains to protect themselves from the mental issues that they could face by being in virtual reality non-stop. As a result, many parents ought to monitor their children in order to prevent them from being addicted and committing suicide, for example.  

On the other hand, when children spend their time by forming strategies in order to complete the next level of the game, they surely become more responsible for the result and gain important skills such as strategic thinking and tactic vision which might be helpful for them in their study in the university and the future life, and I agree. By being involved in the process of building a strategy and being responsible for the results, children will be aware of the future consequences of their failure. Moreover, playing video games encourages some young people to be interested in coding and software development and, probably, choose it as their future major in university.

To sum up, although lots of people vary in their opinion, I strongly believe that playing games on the computer may provide children with many benefits in their future adult lives.

prompt: Some people believe that climate change has the greatest effect on people’s way of life. Others believe the economy of the region has the greatest effect. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
essay:
Many topics we can gain from newspapers or social media and climate change is one of them. Nowadays, plenty of people assume climate change can increase the temperature of the earth so it forces people to adapt with that situation. Furthermore, the economy in the place where we live also makes us adjust our lifestyle to be fit with our environment. 

Climate change has been a hot topic lately since it gives great impact on humans and the most noticeable problem is an increasing of earth temperature. In Indonesia for instance, people who live in Bandung, which is known as highland, need Air Conditioner (AC) and it's an adaptation done by humans to keep feeling cold. Climate change not only can affect temperature but also it makes messy weather schedule.This random weather creates new habits that are made so people can go their whole lives without being bothered by the weather.  Workers who always bring their umbrella and consume vitamins are behaviors that came from random weather problems.

People who live in Jakarta and people who live in Semarang surely has different lifestyles and it because the rate of economy there. Region where have high rate economy make sellers can sell their products with high price as they know people who live there can afford to buy it. Same way of selling can not applied in low rate economy region. That different makes people need to adjust their lifestyle to place where they live. For example, Semarang people only need Rp 10.000 to get Nasi Padang (Indonesia traditional food) but in Jakarta you need to spend as much money as Rp 15.000 to get the same food. Not only that, the economic rate in a region also give impact to the government about the tax rate. 

Either climate change and region economic rate can affect people’s live. In my own opinion climate change give more impact compared region economic rate since climate change could involve to world community but region economic rate only affects that region.

prompt:
Some people are of the view that students should keep a gap of one year without study between school and university. While others think it affects learning.  

Discuss both viewpoints and give your opinion by giving relevant reasons and examples.
essay:
University submission is perhaps time-consuming for people, and some think it will be beneficial if a gap year system is applied between the last year in senior high and the university application period.However, there are parts of the community that think the gap year policy will degrade students' ability to learn. This essay will discuss further two perspectives regarding the one-year gap scheme and illustrate each case.

On one hand, gap year regulation gives both parents and students time in preparing the application requirements thoroughly. In fact, kids are enforced to meet the qualification where they have to be  straight-A students in class as well as involved actively in the community. Apparently, being a part of  society consumes  extra time and some children are prioritised to have an extra lesson instead. For instance, some children who are not prepared for an exam tend to take the private lessons outside school time which obviously affects their availability in taking volunteering in their neighbourhood. As a result, their submission process might be affected due to this situation. Therefore, the gap year system will suit high schoolers who want to continue their study.

On the other hand, some might think this system is reckless where children might be affected and loosen their strategy through university. It is understandable that youngsters are unstable especially if they are not encouraged. Giving them a space of time is a bit risky from some perspectives. To illustrate, after graduation, there will be no formal supervision for the kids which means some can lose their motivation and spirit during the period of preparation. Although they are grownups, their instability dominates in decision-making. Instead of being well-prepared, a gap year might impact their enthusiasm to learn.

To conclude, gap year regulation impact differently amongst children. It might be a positive decision where students focus on one activity at a time resulting high acceptance rate in university. Nevertheless, it might affect negatively youngsters which impacts their learning processes.

Some argue that machines with artificial intelligence are critical to improving people's futures, while others argue that the invention of robots is a risk that can have negative consequences for society.I believe robots are crusial becouse without robots we cannot be achive the production that is required.

In many countries, robots have become crucial to the development of the economy as they engage in not only manufacturing but also service industries. Robots can survive in conditions that humans cannot, for example,roots are working in a mining area where the air contains poisonous gases and they extract valuable resouse to use for human  . In addition, automated machines are used in car manufacturing because they can work long hours continuously and, in most cases, are more effective than humans.Therefore, global productivity has increased significantly, which is good for future human development. I believe this is a great advantage of robots.

On the other hand, robots can be used in military and anti-social tasks such as causing harm to people and other tasks because the machines only obey their owner's rules and may not consider human feelings or other humans' values. For example, a major Japanese corporation built military robots; after an experiment, they deactivated those robots; however, one of the robots automatically reactivated and connected to the Internet to gather information and become stronger.I believe that this negative impact of rebots can be eliminated by taking strong regulatory measures

In conclusion, robots can positively influence human future  development by increasing global productivity; however, they might be dangerous unless controlled by the govenment .

prompt: Some people think that robots are very important for human’s future development. Others, however, think that robots are a dangerous invention that could have negative effect on society. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
The phenomenon of the effects of robots technologies development has aroused wide concern among various circles. Divergent as people's views on the issue in question may be, I believe that it is more beneficial for humans in the future.

On one hand, some people think robots will take their job away because the expenditure on robots is noticeably less than human salary. For instance, the basic cost between machines and human has dramatically different. Machines only need fuel and time-to-time maintenance, but a human requires much more, ranging from housing, food, and clothes to transportation. It reflects a company's spending on machines and humans respectively. As a result, some people strongly reject the development of robots.

On the other hand, I believe that automatons can bring us a more wide range of benefits. One of the advantages is that they can work in dangerous environments such as clearing the wall of tall buildings and deforestation. This will in turn prevent the accident occur. Another reason is better shipping efficiency with lower prices, it is beneficial to most businesses these days. For example, automatons shipping can run 24 hours a day which means the period of delivery will be decreased, and the price should be able to cut off half of the original shipping cost because it does not need to pay salary to a machine. Therefore, many people feel that robot development can bring us a better future.

Under this line of thinking, although there is a good reason in favour of the argument that robots are dangerous inventions for our future, I believe automatons development would replace us to finish the most basic work and allow people to live their own life.

Globally, a few humans believe that youngsters should use television but others do not have the same thoughts. TV is a good tool for learning in this generation since technology has become significant presently. Its bad effects cannot  be overlooked. I think its utilisation for youngsters is essential for their mental development.

    To begin with, viewing a TV set has a positive impact on the intellectual development of a child. It prompts them to challenge their brains and generate ideas especially while seeing educational channels like lingo kids.Certain situations have shown improvements in learning grammar if a kid is consistent in watching English programmes. In ,addition it serves as a form of entertainment for lads during holiday periods. For example, videos and cartoons are basic measures of fun.The role of screens is important in every child's development.

       The universal use of home screens has contributed to reduced morals exhibited by juveniles of today. A lot of adult shows are aired freely and these children have the freedom to watch them. Recent statistics have shown that about 50- 60% of users of porn hub sites are humans of age 9 to 14.Furthermore, it is time-consuming. A minor spends about 5 hours watching channels and this time could be used for other valuable activities such as domestic chores.

     In my opinion, visualising TVs has shown to be essential to optimal brain activities of children. Younger ones who view educative channels regularly have more confidence in dealing with life challenges.For instance, seeing people do debates on Sets gives children the confidence that every idea is valid.Also, televisions are used for virtual feedback for young lads with cerebral palsy. Thus the use of home screens by boys and girls is a significant part of growth.

      In conclusion, the good effects of viewing TV sets by children are very essential in this modern world although their bad factors are there too.Subsequently, every offspring is encouraged to see home screens for at least 30mins to 1 hour daily.

In the present day, the consequences of climate change are a primary concern in any society. While some people claim that is necessary efforts of everybody to solve this problem, others believe that the ideal should be to learn to live with it. I tend to agree with the former because we live in a society and taking care of the planet is a duty and obligation.

Solving this problem can ameliorate not only the quality of air but also the quality of water, which are essential resources for surviving. Moreover, improving the quality of both, the number of diseases resulting to them may mitigate. Another important fact about this situation is that by solving this current problem, we can prevent the loss of biodiversity resulting in the maintenance of natural habits. 

On the other hand, some people claim this resolution is a process incredibly expensive and demanding. Therefore,  financial resources should be invested in other fields. Furthermore, the necessary time to tackle this hassle is  uncountable since would be a process without resolutions in a short term. As far as I am concerned, citizens need to combat this situation as we are  responsible for this crucial moment on our planet.  In addition, if the population fights to solve climate change, it will build a better place for the next generations. Another essential fact about this is that schools and organizations, both national and local, can promote educational programs to influence healthy and good habits to the planet. The more society strives to go the extra mile, the better results.   

In conclusion, climate change is a complex and current problem that needs to be solved, otherwise, the negative impacts will endanger not only  human life but also  animal life. The planet is claiming for helping and it is of paramount importance at least trying to diminish the consequences to the next generations.
