prompt: In some countries, people encourage students to find part-time jobs while some people don't. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
It is often suggested that students should indulge in part-time internships while undergoing their studies. Some people, however, may argue and discourage students from doing so. I will discuss both  views in this essay but personally, I believe that youngsters must find part-time jobs which will help them in long term.

To begin with, those who do not favour students in applying for half-time placement states their reason that freshmen should concentrate on their studies and complete their degree with distinction. They think that getting involved in work at this stage will create unnecessary extra pressure that will lead to low grades in college or university. Moreover, they think that this time can be utilized more on exam preparations required for higher studies. For example, undergraduates in their final year usually do not opt for any internships and exploit their time in preparing for MBA and master’s exams. Hence, for these reasons, some individuals do not encourage pupils to work.

On the other hand, part-time jobs offer lots of advantages to younglings. Firstly, they can apply their theoretical knowledge and gain immense experience through these temporary placements. And secondly, the work experience gained can help them land  their dream jobs as most recruiters prefer people having some experience. For example, many engineering colleges in India have made it compulsory for their students to undergo two months of internship which benefits them in achieving their dream career. Therefore, it is advised to undertake a part-time profession for the above-mentioned motives.

In conclusion, I agree that students must take on part-time jobs to ensure that they gain relevant experience which will give them an enormous advantage in developing their careers.

With the advancement of artificial intelligence, there are many people who advocate that humanoid robots can replace completely humans. Indeed, it might a trend in the contemporary day; however, I believe that some jobs are still requested for real people.  This essay will discuss compelling examples to sustain my belief. 

There is no doubt that Ai can do numerous works. Because of deep learning and AI algorithms, computer and robots can apply repetitive and simple work, such as manufacturing and accounting. Take factories for example. Through precision computer science, AI might improve effectiveness, accuracy, and productivity compared with what traditional laborers did in the manufactory. Also, AI workers will work for their employers without asking for rest. It is significant to accelerate the productivity and the quality of production. 

On the other hand, AI might not take over some intricate jobs which are required for human judgment and experience.  For example, some medical procedures should be operated by skilled surgeons. It is because complex surgeries are crucial and are related to legal issues. Thus, human surgeons should take responsibility for medical decisions instead of AI robots.  Although there are increasing numbers of driverless cars on roads, the autopilot system is reported with an unexpected gap in the reality and causes several fatal car accidents worldwide. Thus, AI-driven vehicles cannot fully substitute for drivers in the short-term time.

In conclusion, even if it is convenient to utilize AI to enhance the efficiency of the job market, I believe that it cannot fully dominate employment and take the place of humans in all aspects of fields.

prompt: Experts believe that over the next decade, robots will be doing many of the jobs currently done by humans. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this.
essay:
Nobody is a stranger to the fact that we live in a digital world. Many experts contend that over the next 10 years, robots will take over the jobs in many industries, which are currently done by people. To my way of thinking, there are both pros and cons to this proposal in equal measure. 

There are many advantages, if you ask me, to this situation. In the first place, it increases work productivity at the workplace. Machines can work much longer hours than human employees without taking breaks. Their result is much more efficient and far more accurate than employees. People may make mistakes at work, but machines do not. Added to this, they do not have to be paid. Some occasional repairs are may be required over the long periods.  This saves a great amount of money for businesses. For instance, many supermarkets in many countries use automatic customer check-out points, which avoid hiring many workers. 

Be that as it may, the downsides of this phenomenon, if you ask me, are just as big. For one thing, it raises the unemployment rate. People who lose jobs because of this will have no income and therefore no money to spend. This could cause serious consequences for the economy. To name but one example, governments cannot get taxes from individuals. As a result of this, governments do not have enough funds for schools, hospitals, public transport and many other facilities and infrastructure. It follows to stand, therefore, that the quality of all essential services will suffer. 

Turning to my own experience, the way things are when it comes to this issue in my country, China, is the same as it was across the world over. My home city of Shanghai is a classic case in point. Here, many factories use robots to make products. Many workers cannot find jobs due to the higher preferences for machines in industrial sectors. 

At the end of the day, there are merits and drawbacks to all choices we make in life. It is very important that governments play a role in creating enough employment opportunities for humans. This will develop their societies in a much more sustainable way.
evaluation:

The essay adequately addresses the prompt by discussing both the advantages and disadvantages of robots taking over jobs currently done by humans. prompt: Nowadays, more and more jobs and tasks which involve hard physical work are done by machines. Do the positive effects of this trend outweigh the negative effects?
essay:
It is increasingly common that smart machines have been applied in some situations in which normal workers can not touch or accomplish. Therefore, I totally tend to agree such a phenomenon is productive for most labourers, corporations, and countries. 

Admittedly, utilizing machines may result in some workers losing their jobs, especially those who are semi-literates or illiterates in a short period. While the governments can take various measures –training classes, declining taxes, and so on- to diminish this situation.

In terms of individuals, without hard work conditions, it means that they are under good protection and lower threats from uncontrolled weather or disasters. Compared with the last century, miners need to dig raw materials (such as coal, gold, iron, etc. ) via hammers and shovels  in the underground, which means they are not only in high-intensity work but also at threat of toxic gas; while today, so many robots and artificial machines are utilized in such dangerous field which dramatically reduces the chance that workers be hurt. In addition, as a company leader, what makes he/she most concerned is investments and profits. It is undeniable that machines can promote efficiency and enduring working during the same workload and limited time; when compared to hundreds of labourers. That is why a number of corporate leaders are fonder of taking revolutions in old product lines with new and reliable technologies. More importantly, applying machines in different fields is a symbol of a modern country, which means a good deal of talented people and perfect industry systems are already paying off.

To sum up, artificial machines allow people to get rid of hard work. although utilizing these smart apparatuses may have negative effects on a part group, it can reduce the rate of safety and develop good outcomes in the long term.

prompt:
Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificial robots. What is your opinion?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant example from your knowledge or experience. Write at least 250 words.
essay:
Nowadays, some people assume that occupations might be substituted progressively by artificial robots in the future. In my opinion, although a majority of simple jobs will be done by robots ultimately, it is impossible that positions which require human relations can be replaced. This essay will discuss the reasons why only particular jobs will be finally taken over.

Without a doubt, artificial robots will easily overtake the jobs that do not require specific and complex human skills in the workforce. From a cost point of view, many companies will choose to use artificial intelligence because it is far less expensive than training and employing a human. Cashiers in supermarket, for instance, are gradually being replaced by checkout machines that cost far less than employees. Customers can easily pay for their goods by using self-checkout facilities rather than standing in a long queue to wait for services at a counter. For these reasons, using artificial robots can be a significantly effective way for companies. 

Conversely, there are some complicated human jobs that will never be overtaken by robotic intelligence because robots do not have the capacities to achieve. In other words, some particular occupations require complex and critical thinking that only human brain can do. For example, science-related jobs, such as doctors, scientists, pharmacists, engineers, can only be carried out by the professionals, even in the future. Robots will not be able to sort out all of the problems which need to be overcome by human. 

In conclusion, with the development of advanced technology, it is no doubt that robots have the abilities to replace a significant number of occupations in the near future. Unskilled labour will eventually be done by machines entirely; however, some sophisticated fields that require specific and complicated human skills will always exist. Consequently, occupations in particular professional areas will be safe in an increasingly artificial intelligent world.

prompt: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. What is your opinion?
essay:
In the future, artificially intelligent robots will do all jobs, replacing humans in the workforce. While it is possible that robots will eventually do all exactly repetitive jobs, it is unlikely that jobs that require empathy skills by humans will be taken over. This essay will discuss why people, not replaced by robots, will carry out only some specific jobs.

Robots may do jobs with repetitive and straightforward steps that do not require specific and complex human skills. Many companies have applied artificial intelligence robots into programmable tasks to improve processes instead of hiring and training their employees. In many manufacturing factories, for example, many routine production steps have been replaced by automated solutions run by robots that cost far less than employees. In addition, the automated stations work around the clock and require no holiday or sick leave like the workforce. For these reasons, some suitable jobs that can be suitable by robotic process automation will be replaced.

On the contrary, some human jobs cannot be replaced by robots because artificial robots will never reach the efficient capacity to do them. The jobs that need psychology, education, medical, and social work require human empathy. In undeveloped countries, for instance, uneducated people need social workers to help them relieve their minds. Additionally, when people face fatal health problems, such as cancer, doctors gradually attempt to empathise, parallel with a situation assessment, to their relatives or even directly to patients. Therefore, it is too complicated that robots will be programmed to well complete those jobs instead of humans being.

In conclusion, it is increasingly possible that robots will be gradually replaced most human tasks soon. Robots may entirely complete the unskilled jobs; however, not all jobs are replaced by automated solutions, sophisticated jobs that still need empathy from humans will always exist. Ultimately, the complicated jobs that are required a high-skilled workforce are still safe parallel in the automated solution environment increasing.

While some people believe that this trend should not be followed, others argue that it helps to build strong minded teenagers. In this essay, I will discuss both sides of the argument and explain my support for the latter view.

One of the most important drawback of teenagers involved in part time jobs is time management. The younsters who work in any part time job are mostly undergarduate students or higher secondary students, because of their part time jobs they get very less time for their studies which in turn leads to bad scores in their marksheets.  Additionally, some part time jobs includes morning and late night shifts, which is the most important time for good sleep. As a reult it directly effects the productivity of the teenagers.

However, part time jobs gives the opportunity to experience real time world apart from studies and college life. Working experience gives the chance to learn from your own mistakes from a very young age, that hepls to build the stronger future. For example, there are some students who does not have any financial support for their education, they  can earn their living and fulfill their dreams, and achieve their goals by their own.

In conclusion, working as a part time can be proven hectic for young generation. In my opinion benefits of part time jobs in young generation are outweighted by the drwabacks, I would prefer top indulge my children in part time jobs.

prompt:
Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots. 
What is your opinion?
essay:
Some may argue that in the future all human workforces will be replaced by robots. While it is possible that most low skill jobs will be taken over by artificial intelligent computers, it is still difficult for some area of work to fully rely on them. This essay will discuss why in the end humans are still needed to do many other jobs.

First, the majority of the non-complex occupation will be handle by robot in the future. It simply because, robot can be easily programmed to do a constant and simple job, moreover, companies will try their best to limit the salary expense by hiring more robots to replace the non-essential workforce. In Indonesia for example, they already started to create an automatic payment gate in every toll-roads. In addition, this automatic gate now being implemented and more common to be found as an exit gate in the parking area. For these reasons, ,eventually many low-level jobs will be replaced by robot in the future.

On the other hand, there are a lot of specific jobs that utterly cannot be substituted by another thing but human.  This condition applies because that kind of work often needs the intervere of the human brain as decision-makers. Doctors for instance, need to analyse many aspects of patients before taking actions and receipt of proper medicines. That kind of complex decision-making process is very unique and robot will not be able to compete with humans.

In conclusion, even though in the future robot might take over many kinds of job, there are still numerous jobs that will never be replaced by it, more specifically jobs that involving the decision-making process. Ultimately, the increasing number of robots as work labourers are an inevitability and only a few jobs will incompatible for them.

prompt:
It is generally observed that almost all high level jobs are done by men.Does it mean that the government should encourage a certain percentage of these jobs to be observed for women?
Do you agree or disagree with this proposition?
essay:
Nowadays, a great deal of attention has been paid to gender equality. Some people insist that government should quote the percentage of men and women who engage in managing jobs. I strongly agree with the idea because gender inequality is a severe problem in this contemporary world, and it is difficult to solve this without support from the government.

To begin with, the first reason why I support this is that there is a huge gap between males and females at workplaces. In fact, men more likely to be promoted than women in Japan. Japan is ranked 121st out of 150 countries regarding Gender Gap Index in 2020, and there are 10 per cent of female who play important role at office. This is because men have been jacked up the scores for a long time, and this is not because women inferior to man.

Another reason why I believe the government have better observe high-level positions for females is that society needs legal force. In general, managing positions are dominated by men in Japan. As a result, women struggle to be promoted and become executives. Traditionally, seniors do not think women become a member of society, since it had been considered that the greatest success as a woman is to become a housewife and raise children. Hence, it is easier to direct gender equality for companies when the government set a rule.

To conclude, I reiterate my complete agreement with the topic. This is because unfairness among men and women is the critical problem, and it quote is vital to enforce companies to put women at higher positions.
evaluation:

essay:

In future we can see way more robots in the military, replacing humans. Other than  few tasks, artificial intelligence cannot replace the individual.

essay:
Men have dominated job sector since the industry revolution, despite progress in gender equality. Men still seem to outnumber the women in terms of employment in tech business. In this essay I shall discuss the issues tossed against women in securing these jobs and changes that need to be put forth to reduce this inequality. 

Regardless of having equal or superior skills to their male counterpart, women often feel societal pressure and cultural norms work against them while seeking jobs. Interviewers question the female applicants about their martial and parental status to understand their personal commitments before offering them the job, hence women are pushed to carefully guard their details in an interview, so they don’t lose out on the job. Additionally, not having a collage degree or computer science graduation tend to lower their confidence at workplace or when applying for jobs, because in many cultures’ families encourage men to pursue higher education while women are pushed performed household activities. For instances in Asian countries people believe that men are bread winners of the family as well as invest in their education but on the other hand women are taught to take care of the home and perform domestic work. All these factors make the career path of a woman more challenging.

Many women activist across the globe have brought up this issue to the society and fought gender equality in job market. As result of this, today many corporate companies incorporated polices to ensure their work force have equal number of women and men employee. Other than this IT sector need diligently transform their corporate culture to respect all employees, moreover make discrimination and gender inequality socially unacceptable. These changes will make the womenfolk feel more secure and boost their morality, thus we can perhaps close the gap between gender disparity.

To conclude, cultural norms need to change in employment and educational settings to permanently eliminate the problem of gender discrimination, so every woman can feel confident, supported and safe as they pursue their dreams.

prompt: Some people believe that eventually all jobs will be done by artificially intelligent robots.
essay:
Artificially intelligent robots are progressively replacing humans in the workforce. While it is possible that all menial jobs will eventually done by robots, it is unlikely that jobs that require human contact will be taken over. This essay will discuss why eventually only very few jobs will be carried out by people.

Robots may eventually replace all human labour that does not require specific and complex human skills. Many companies will turn to artificial intelligence because it is far less expensive than hiring, training and employing a human. In supermarkets in Australia, for example, many cashiers have been replaced by automated stations that cost far less than employees. In addition, these automated stations work around the clock and require no holidays or holiday pay. For these reasons, jobs that can be replaced by robotic intelligence will be replaced.

Conversely, there are some human jobs that cannot be replaced because robots will never achieve the capacity to do them. Put simply, some jobs require a 'human touch'. These jobs include psychology, education, medicine and social work to name but a few. Robots will never be able to achieve what has taken social evolution hundreds of thousands of years to achieve.

It is increasingly likely that robots will end most human employment. Unskilled labour will eventually be done entirely by robots; however sophisticated jobs that require human specific skills will always exist. Ultimately, few jobs will be safe in an increasingly artificial intelligent workforce.

prompt:
Men and women are different in terms of their characteristics and abilities. For this reason, some jobs are better done by men and others by women.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
These days, it seems that more women are entering “male occupations” than ever before and vice versa. While some still hold to the conservative view that certain jobs are better performed by men and others by women, it is my personal belief that people of their sex are capable of doing any job effectively. The reasons for my position are as follows.

First of all, I believe it is a mistake to base our views on broad generalisations about the characteristics of men and women as such stereotypes are often inaccurate. Although there are certainly traits which are typical of men and others which are typical of women, there are exceptions to every rule. Not all women are physically weak, just as not all men are poor interpersonal communicators; conventional gender roles are not appropriate for everybody. If a man and woman desires to pursue a career which is traditionally reserved for the opposite sex, I believe he/ she should be provided the opportunity to prove him/ herself capable.

Secondly, I would contend that the presence of both males and females in a workplace brings a sense of balance. Men and women frequently, though by no means always, have different methods of doing things. Rather than judging these differences to be weakness, I feel that we should view them as opportunities for innovation and the discovery of more effective and efficient work practices. A person’s weakness can thus be transformed into strengths.

In summary, I once again reaffirm my position that both male and female employees are an asset to any industry and as our stereotypes about men and women are not always appropriate, we must not discourage anyone from choosing an occupation simply because of his/ her gender.

prompt: Many university graduates cannot find a job in their chosen profession. What factors may have caused this situation and what, in your opinion, should be done about it?
essay:
When young people are choosing what subject to study at university, most of them hope they will find a great job upon graduation. In reality many fresh graduates fail to find work in their field and some are even forced to take up a below graduate level job. In my opinion, the root of this problem lies in the outdated higher education system that should be modernized.
Traditional university education does not prepare students for their first job for a number of reasons. One of them is that many programmes are too theoretical. It means that highly educated graduates lack simple skills required for employment, for example, the knowledge of IT software. Employers, therefore, prefer candidates with hands-on experience. Another reason is that universities offer too many courses in popular fields, such as business and law, and do not recruit enough students for engineering and science programmes. As a result, the UK labour market has an oversupply of law graduates and a deficit of engineers. 
A reform of higher education could alleviate many of the problems but would require joint efforts from universities and the government. If universities worked closer with employers, they could teach students practical skills that companies look for. Meanwhile, the government could develop guidelines on how many students universities should recruit in each subject in accordance with the market demand.
In conclusion, a likely reason why many graduates cannot find a job in their field is because university education might not have provided them with the right skill set or an in-demand profession. I think that universities and the government could improve the situation by updating the content of the programmes and limiting the number of students in each subject in line with the market demand.
evaluation:

The essay adequately covers all aspects of the task, providing relevant arguments and evidence to support the points made. essay:
One of Mr. Carter's most important jobs is that of public relations director. The purpose of this job is to establish a good attitude toward his country among the public (people) of the origin country. As part of this job, he supervises the writing and distribution of press releases (news stories) for the media. Media refers to all the ways of spreading information, such as newspapers, radio, television, and other means of communication. Media is a plural word, meaning it refers to all these means. Radio is a medium of communication; it is one of the media used for advertising. Public relations people place special news stories in the media to help build interest in the destination country. Advertisements in the media, paid for by the tourism department, also help establish interest.

Employees in public relations and advertising must be fluent in English if they work in English-speaking countries. "To be fluent" means to speak, read, and write a language almost as well as the natives do. Mr. Carter's staff members write advertisements, news releases, and brochures to promote travel to their country. They give lectures (talks) and show films about their country to groups of people. They answer questions about travel to their country.

Mr. Carter holds press conferences whenever something of importance or interest happens in his country. A press conference is a meeting attended by reporters from newspapers, magazines, radio, or television. At a press conference, someone makes announcements that their readers, listeners, or viewers might find interesting. Whenever an important person from his country visits, Mr. Carter holds a press conference to introduce that person to the representatives of the media. Such news items help to build interest in and knowledge about his country.

Information offices also give tourists and immigrants helpful information. The clerks give them any necessary documents or visas that may be required for entrance. The staff can also tell them about different laws and regulations in the destination country.

Mr. Carter and his staff also work with businesses and industries that might be interested in either moving to or doing business with the destination country. Mr. Carter's country wants foreign industries to come and help build industry there. The country is also interested in exporting some of its products. In turn, the country is anxious to get the best prices on products imported from other countries.

Wherever they go and whatever they do, the information staff members represent their country. "We are the face of our country to the rest of the world," Mr. Carter says. "Before they know anything about our country, people form their impressions and attitudes about it from the things we do and say."
evaluation:

prompt: Whether or not someone achieve their aims is mostly by a question of luck. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many people claim that luck is the most crucial element contributing to a person's success. While I accept that luck does have an important role in helping people reach their targets, I would argue that hard work and determination are much more crucial factors leading to the achievement of an individual. 

On the one hand, I agree that luck can be an important factor. First, some people are fortunate enough to be born in a wealthy family, which allows them to have a better education or to easily start their own business without having to borrow money from someone else. As a result, these people tend to have better opportunities to succeed than those coming from poor families. Furthermore, some individuals are lucky to be given great talents which others do not have. For example, Mozart was able to play music when he was very young, or Lionel Messi already had great football skills when he was born. 

However, I would argue that although luck can be necessary, it is not the most crucial factor leading to success. Firstly, people need to work really hard and put much effort into their jobs if they want to be successful. For instance, before becoming one of the best football players in the world, Cristiano Ronaldo had to go through intense training hours every day for many years. Secondly, a person is less likely to reach his targets if he does not have determination. On the way leading to success, there might be many difficulties, and people need to keep moving forward to overcome those challenges. 

In conclusion, while I agree that luck is important to some extent in helping people become successful, I believe that hard work and determination are the most important elements.

prompt: Some people say in order to prevent illness and disease, governments should focus on reducing environmental pollution and housing problem. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is argued that governments should prioritize addressing environmental pollution and housing issues as a means to prevent health-related problems. From my perspective, I largely agree with this statement.

On the one hand, there are several methods to deter illness and disease that the government can invest in. Biological research or clinical study could be taken as prominent examples. These studies potentially lead to a better understanding, or better yet, new knowledge about different aspects of health issues, thereby preventing illness and eliminating the roots of it efficiently. However, these research plans may incur substantial costs due to the need for numerous facilities. Consequently, governments might expend on these domains but do not necessarily focus on them.

On the other hand, an investment in reducing environmental problems and house-related ones are seemingly more effective than the aforementioned. First and foremost, people are exposed to the surrounding environment, including both public areas and houses, on a daily basis. hence, if there are some evironment issues such as air pollution or water pollution, their health is immediately impacted profoundly; and because of this, when such problems are addressed, the benefits will quickly come as a result. For instance, when air pollution in Hanoi is reduced due to municipal initiatives, reports indicate a decrease in the number of respiratory-related patients. Ultimately, it is more urgent to tackle issues related to the environment and housing.

In conclusion, while there may be other remedies to prevent ailments and diseases such as scientific research, I advocate that emphasis on reducing environmental and housing problems is of paramount significance.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this? 

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
There is an increasing number of people who are interested in excavating the history of the house or building where they live. I think people do that because they have the cognitive to protect the historical value of the buildings and the sense of connection that people felt within the exploration. In order to research their history, people can gather the knowledge and memories that elder citizens around them have and go to the libraries in their cities.

Many buildings with great historical value had been destroyed because of the wars and people's ignorance in the past. Therefore, many people appeal for the protection of buildings. After people have the cognitive to appreciate the  beauty of historical buildings, people willing to find out the history of the buildings in their own living places. What's more, the process of exploring the stories about the buildings in their cities enhances the connection between them. Because the forms of architecture are special due to the unique elements a location has, such as weather and culture, these link everyone who lives there and make them feel united.

In order to know the history of the building where they live, one of my suggestions is to ask the elders who also live there. Because they have more experiences since the more time they have lived, they might have experienced the changes of the time of these architectures. Another suggestion is going to local libraries and searching for the information which had been recorded on paper.

In conclusion, people's increasing interest in excavating the history of  architecture in the place they live is due to their cognitive of protection after the destruction of many buildings and the sense of connection that is given to explorers. My suggestions for explorers to reach this intention are asking the local elders for help and searching for information in local libraries.

In conclusion, researching the history of a house or building can be really interesting. People can know about the shape and roots of these accommodations, and know how to find them. prompt:

-What are the reasons for this?

essay:
Nowadays, we can find growing number of people who are inclined to find out histories of their accommodations in some countries. It would be interesting and productive to figure out the reasons for this surging interest, and the way to research this. 

In terms of reasons for this, I believe there are economic and educational reasons. First and foremost, the financial motivation is the biggest and outstanding. In some countries, there are many antique cities containing ancient building built in middle age. If the old building has special history and the owner could reveal it, he could earn a myriad of money. For example, if the accommodation I live was once an office of Adam Smith, the father of modern economic theory, the value of building will certainly upsurge. Secondly, investigating the history of their own house would be good research topic for children. By studying the history and collecting anecdotes of building, children can easily learn the history of their family, hometown. It could be challenging but also riveting project. In this way, history education would be much friendly to many children. 

For researching the history of buildings, I can suggest three methods. First of all, meticulous research of old writings, including history books, novels, biographies are important. We can find some hints from those literature. And in terms of reliability, historical writing is most credible source. In addition, anecdotal approach will be also useful. History telling form elderly people who lived nearby building would be one of the most important sources. It would give detail information about building, also it could invigorate our imagination. Lastly, art and architecture approaches are also significant. This approach can help find the origin of the building.  

In conclusion, learning about history of our own houses is beneficial in both economic and educational way. To render good research, we need to study fastidiously relevant literatures, anecdotes, and architecture factors.

In some nations, people are starting to be fascinated about getting to know more about what happened to their accommodations a long time ago. This is because the history of some buildings and houses could be very valuable, especially those that have stayed for thousands of years and a few ways to work out this are to ask grandparents and other elderly in the house and to look at the construction of the building.

One reason why the history of a house or building is appealing to householders is that ancient houses could be very valuable due to their special ways of being constructed. This is either because of the war or the common features of a house at that time and they are greatly invaluable since there is no such thing nowadays. For example, there is a house that stayed since the colony of French from two centuries ago until now in Quang Ninh district in Vietnam. The house was owned by an old man for a long period and when he died, it was preserved by the government because there were secret tunnels everywhere in the house and these were the evidence for how people survived  falling bombs in the war.

There are many ways to discover the history of the place where we are living and the most convenient one is to ask our grandparents and other older people who have lived there for ages. Grandparents are those who very respect history and they might live in the war period so by putting questions, they will be very willing to tell us not only their past but also the past of the house, in what condition it was constructed and why it was built there. Additionally, people can also look for the answer to this question by taking a look at the construction of the house. Places that have been built for a long time will have different ways of being constructed due to the technique and knowledge of people at that period of  history. For instance, in Hoian City, houses with red roofs and walls with special materials are abundant in virtue of the fact that this is an ancient city in Vietnam and this is also the preservation of the buildings in the Nguyen dynasty.

In conclusion, people are eager to know more about the history of their accommodations  because houses with a long past could be very highly valued in the way how they were constructed since they were one of the most crucial pieces of evidence in the development of human beings. To research more about this, people can come to their ancestors for more specific information and try to discover the difference between the construction of our house and other ones is also a useful way as well.

prompt:
In some countries more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.

What are the reasons for this?

How can people research this?
essay:
There is increasing tendency amongst people from some nations who want to know more about the history of the house or building they live in. This can be out of some curiosity or just for fun to share with their family. However, it can be needed for more practical reasons such as interior or reconstruction. This essay will explore the reasons behind this trend and suggest how to find out useful information.

Some people may be simply curious about who previously had lived in their house and whether any special or unusual events had happened there. These stories can be either a good-luck sign or a cautious point for them if there had been some successful or dangerous stories and give them a wider perspective where they dwell.

Others, on the other hand, may wonder about the specific information for their certain purposes. They may be willing to rebuild the house or make a big interior change of it. For those reasons, some researches about the house like the date of construction, structure and materials used are needed in advance. Since learning about the accurate information and history is sometimes crucial for the conservation or reconstruction.  

To collect such information of a house or a building, there are various ways available. The easiest way is to ask your real estate agency of previous owners of the house. You can trace a lot of behind stories in short time. Those can be fun but may not be quite useful, though. In terms of the practical and official information,  you can visit the websites of city council and managing authority to track them. Lastly, checking out a library in your neighborhood may be a decent choice. They may have tons of information or archives about the area and also each buildings respectively.    

 

To sum up, this trend can be mainly from the pure curiosity or some practical reasons for living in. Whatever the reasons are, this information can be found simply from the agency or the ex-owners of the house, websites of the city council or managing authority and local libraries.

For example, when people buy a second house, it will be better to know the past by asking the neighbours who are living close to the property.

To sum up, many reasons why people do research about their living place, such as nowadays the community have a high curiosity and also they have a strong principle, which is unknown, unloved. prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in.
What are the reasons for this? 
How can people research this?
essay:
The history of a house or a building can be fascinating, sometimes daunting or even mesmerising at times if we try to delve into it. For some people, learning about the history of the houses, in which they live, is utterly important for various reasons. This essay attempts to outline some of those possible reasons for this and a couple of methods to research this.

The first possible reason for many to become inquisitive about the past of their houses could be that they actually want to find a connection, if any, between themselves and the buildings. Such connections, or lack thereof, could actually provide an insight to them as to whether those buildings contained anything “unique” at some stages of their existence that would make them- the people that is – feel “special” among the others, or “different” from the rest of the crowds in their neighbourhoods. After all, I think that it feels really good to remain at the centre of attention every now and then.

Some people would be interested to learn about the history of their buildings, especially how they were built, or what kinds of materials were used to construct them because they want to make sure that the buildings are safe enough for living. After all, nobody would want to put their lives at risk by choosing to live in a “weak” building that was built with some “unreliable” materials about a century ago! 

But, for whatever reasons that they want to learn about the history of their buildings, it is always better that they ask the locals first to get their information about the former residents of their houses. They could also contact the local municipality or the concerned local authority who could apprise them about how the buildings were made. Finally, people could also visit a local library or the authority that keeps the information about old buildings, to learn about the history of buildings in their respective areas. 

To conclude, people are becoming more and more interested in the history of their houses primarily to find a unique feature of it to feel special or to learn about the architectural style and safety features of the house. They can contact local residents, municipality offices and the library to do the research work required to find the history of their houses.

prompt:
In some countries, more and more people are becoming interested in finding out about the history of the house or building they live in. 
What are the reasons for this?
How can people research this?
essay:
Real estate buyers are becoming more interested in past information of the building they are buying, which is a common trend around the world. It seems to me that there are two main reasons, including safety concern and psychological belief and several ways to investigate the history of a house.

Firstly, researching a home`s past allows people to make sure about its architectural history for preservation purposes. For example, it is essential to know when it was built, what it is built of, what changes had been made, or how it was used before. This detailed information can help meet the security requirements of the owners so that they can know exactly what changes and repairs need to be made. Secondly, understanding the history of the house in which you live is one of the reasons to live happily. No one wants to live in a house where some dreadful events had happened, such as murder or violence.  

Tracing the history of old houses could be more challenging than contemporary houses. However there can be several ways to explore the history. First, using internet seems possible to compile initial facts since a wide range of records are becoming more available online today. Official websites can be more reliable and provide information on resources and where to find them. Second, information on the history of houses or buildings can be obtained from local authorities, such as National Archives and Property Registry. In addition, real estate realtors should be able to assist the purchasers with finding the basic information, like previous owners.

In conclusion, it appears that feeling satisfied and safe in the house we live in is a reason to discover its history, and online resources and local authorities could be the main source of the information.

prompt: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion?
essay:
in many recent years, the globe is going to be unhabitable for many life forms due to undesirable activities done by humans. As a result, protecting the environment and keeping plants and animals safe has become one of the most controversial issues among scientists and environmental activists. In this regard, some people claim that the current situation can not be improved, while others take the opposite side and believe that some practical decisions should be made. 

On the one hand, some people are of the opinion that the current trend that has been occurring in the world in recent decades is uncontrolled and can not be stopped easily. They believe population explosion and as a result, exploitation of nature and its resources such as water and plants in order to produce foodstuff and necessary products is unavoidable. This is because, in their statements, humans should take priority over all the other creatures. Therefore, it could be noted that, instead of investing huge amounts of either financial or human resources to save some rare species, which can be considered a waste of money because of their insufficiency, we ought to allocate this budget and workforce to enhance the health care and education system in poor countries. For instance, the latest statistics illustrate that the average budget of typical conservation programmes is equal to constructing 50000 schools in Africa where the majority of kids suffer from a lack of education.

On the other hand, many experts state that the current circumstances send a clear message that the globe is going to be unhabitable in the near future for all beings including mankind. This means that planning and implementing conservation programmes and strict rules in order to save special plants and animals not only help them to escape from the circle of extinction but also could shape our children's future in a far more efficient way. As a result, providing that the governments assist to keep the environment in balance by imposing harsh rules to deter factories and individuals from destroying nature, the position will be improved significantly. For example, in Germany, the government introduced harsh penalties for logging and poaching in 2006, which resulted in a substantial drop in the number of animals death figures after 10 years.

To sum up, although changing the available situation is a tough challenge and requires huge investment and international assessments, I firmly believe that this is possible to tackle this problem only if authorities take practical steps.
evaluation:

prompt: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
In recent years,  the development of human civilization has led to many adverse impacts on various other living species.It is argued by a few individuals that much little can be done to tackle this problem, while others think advanced measures can be helpful in controlling the circumstances.This essay will discuss both  notions along with my opinion.

On the one hand, the development of human actions has caused global-level concerns related to animals and plants.First of all,  people have cut huge numbers of trees , which has snatched the habitats of wild creatures , disturbing their normal living, and increasing chances of endangerment and extinction.Taking deforestation as an example, leading to an increased number of problems such as floods , droughts, destruction of habitats and food shortages . However, the solution of more plantations may not become possible due to excessive soil erosion and lack of land.

On the other hand, people believe that circumstances can be made under control if effective measures are taken right away.To begin with,if the community has already realised the value of planting trees , then the government should make provisions related to logging.Moreover , advanced technology can prove effective in protecting endangered animals.For example, China has been utilising genetic technology, especially to protect panda's life.Additionally , the crowd ought to be encouraged to plant more and more trees.Therefore , the adoption of these solutions can be helpful in tackling global concerns directly from the root level.

In conclusion, indeed , human activities have resulted in causing numerous problems for living and non-living organisms.Yet , I believe plantations, advanced technology and strict rules and regulations are effective methods for solving this issue.

prompt:
Human activities have negative effects on plant and animals species. Some people think it 

is too late to do a anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation.

Discuss both views and give our opinion.
essay:
Although humans have long acknowledged the impacts of their actions on flora and fauna systems, they still continue destroying them. And it is still a controversial issue whether it is better to find solutions for this urgent problem or let it be as it is already too late. In this essay, I will examine both viewpoints; however, I strongly believe that "late is better than never" and advocate finding ways to fix  mistakes.

Some people have stopped hoping to change the circumstance that many species of vegetation and animals have died out and more will become extinct in the foreseeable future. Humanity has influenced  biodiversity so badly that nature finds it so hard to recover. For example, when ones are in need of land for cultivation or construction, they cut down trees and cement the soil, resulting in  changes in the natural habitat. Consequently, many species of plants and animals can not survive.

Nevertheless, there is still a chance for us to err the mistakes provided that practical methods are put into action immediately. The prerequisite solution is the authorities had better set strict regulations protecting our nature such as ceasing deforestation and overexploitation. Nothing is more obvious than the example of overfishing which prevents fish from reproducing in time; as a consequence, they become extinct. Last but not least, more campaigns to enlighten every citizen's perceptions should be put into practice. Hopefully, when everyone is conscious of the danger of their actions on the common ecosystem, they will find ways to limit them. 

To conclude, despite the fact that it is rather late to take action on protecting plants and animals, I suppose effective accounts can help reverse the situation.

prompt: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
As natural resources are under increasing pressure, the list of endangered animals and plants is becoming endless. While some might claim that nothing could be done to reverse the trend, I believe that there are still means to ensure a sustainable future for the planet. 

Biodiversity contributes to humanity’s most important life-supporting safety net: nutrition, shelter, clothing, the very water we drink, and the air we breathe. However, our safety net is stretched almost to the breaking point. It is reported that natural forest area continues to decline, marine ecosystems are undermined severely, and countless species are suffering from illegal poaching. Hence, there are increasing voices that question the necessity and viability of making a change. 

Nevertheless, to reverse biodiversity decline, I believe, is still feasible, though difficult. 

Governments could promote a greater understanding of plants and animals by investing in the research and preservation efforts of universities, zoos, and botanical institutes. This may ensure the survival of individual species and produce tangible benefits in the form of new medicines and products. 

An alternative strategy would be to protect natural habitats by expanding nature reserves. This would have immediate positive consequences for those areas by preserving delicate ecosystems. The most effective solution is to limit the damage at the source. Companies that engage in practices that harm the environment should be required to demonstrate that they have taken all reasonable efforts to minimize the damage. Public contracts for roads and buildings should only be awarded to firms that have a good environmental track record. The strategies outlined above could do much to reverse the destruction that threatens the world’s plants and animals. 

To conclude, a planet being pushed to the edge will eventually turn on us. 

With the accelerating rate of mass extinctions of plant and animal species, I believe, effective measures should be taken immediately to make a difference.

prompt: Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species . Some Human activities have negative effects on plant and animal species. Some people think it is too late to do anything about this problem. Others believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give our opinion.
essay:
Some actions of mankind have detrimental effects on flora and fauna. It is believed that there is no time for people to redress their mistakes while some people think that this circumstance can be effectively improved by various solutions. From my perspective, I have a strong belief that several measures can be taken to solve this problem.

To begin with, some people have right reasons to claim that it is an unsolvable problem and nothing can be done to deal with it. Deforestation or climate change caused by human activities is so destructive that it is placing many species’lives at risk. As a consequent, many species of plants and animals are dying due to loss of habitat and human’s hunt. Some of them have already become extinct, thus negatively affecting the balance of the ecosystem. For example, in Vietnam where there used to be a large number of tigers, this animal has been hunted for years to satisfy human’s needs and there are only few species left. 

However, I strongly argue that there are a lot of things that goverments and individuals can do to deal with this problem. Firstly, the issue of deforestation needs to be addressed. It is the main cause of the disapperance of endangered species around the world. Governments can plant more trees to create places for animals and plants to live and develop their population. Moreover, strict rules should be published to deter people from cutting down trees and hunting for precious animals and plants. Another solution is to raise awareness of residents about the destructive effects of our activities to the Earth and the ecosystem. Public talks and lectures about the possible consequences of mankind need to be hold in order to make the public aware of their activities. 

In conclusion, although some people think that there is nothing to solve this problem, I personally believe that there are many effective solutions to solve it. The protection of forest and the awareness of the public are really important in dealing with this issue.

prompt: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. ??
essay:
In our contemporary world, humans have had a destructive impact on the environment and other living creatures. The majority of the population believe that we should take action to preserve our planet, while others have a more critical opinion. Throughout this essay I will discuss both points of view and express my personal opinion on this matter. Firstly, I will discuss the first opinion and ,secondly I will explore the second point of view.

On the one hand, today's modern society contemplate that people should reconsider their actions in order to maintain our world safe. Our extensively destructive activities have pushed many plants and animal species to the edge of extinction and changing even some simple routines and taking a more eco-friendly approach in our life might offer a great deal of improvement to our natural world. For example, if a person walks or rides a bicycle for a short journey rather than driving a car they will cut in carbon dioxide emission effectively and as a result, fresher air would be available in the local community.

On the other hand, there are some people who think that it is too late to even think about saving our planet. They believe that simple individual-based changes would not contribute to any improvement and they can not do anything about this matter. They do not consider themselves responsible for what is happening to the natural world and they are more into blaming ruling authorities for everything. In addition, they hold the government responsible to take serious measurements in order to save the environment. For instance, it is the government's responsibility to implement rules on industries to use filters to minimise the emission of toxic materials.

In conclusion,  Even though the government is the one who can take some serious measures to maintain our planet safe for citizens and other living organisms, humans can also take part in improving their local climate by following some simple actions. In my opinion, we should always feel responsible for the earth we live in and we must ensure the well-being of our habitat.

prompt: Human activities have a negative effect on plant and animal species. Some people say that it is too late to do anything. Some people think that we should take effective action to improve the situation. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. ??
essay:
There are controversial perspectives heating up a debate over how to solve the negative effect issue caused by human activities on plant and animal species. While some hold a strong view that it is too late to measure the problem, the opposite makes a statement that we should enhance the situation with effective actions. I would contend that take effective actions to revamp the matters, which do more good than harm.

 It is obvious to note that there are many reasons to convince that it is too late in order to solve the negative effect of human activities on plant and animal species, one of them is deforestation. Having an ever-growing demand for land to live and wood to consume, humans decide on deforestation to serve their purpose. Therefore, it leads to flora and fauna being indiscriminately destroyed and lost completely instead of being replaced and it pushes many categories of species on the verge of extinction.  For example, Panda is China’s national treasure, but this species is on the brink of extinction because of deforestation. There is a wealth of animals in the world that are dying out because of human activities, which is the reason people doubt that it is too late to tackle the problem. 

 While the redeeming features of negative effects of human activities on flora and fauna species are widely acknowledged, we will find an address in order to enhance the issue. Plant and animal species play a paramount significant role in human’s life, so we should find a solution as soon as possible. One of the remedies is to build a reserve to create a safe habitat for endangered animals. For instance, Cuc Phuong national park in Vietnam is built and overseen by the authorities, which is home for a wave of precious animals. Hence, the situation will be resolved and revamped if people actively implement it.             

 In conclusion, although there are many reasons to prove that it is too late to deal with the negative effect on plant and animal species caused by human activities, people should take effective action to improve the problem.

Human being has always been abusing the mother earth since the industrial revolution. Almost every kind of environmental problem or animal distinction, are the negative result of human activities. Some people believe that we can still save our planet and immediate actions must be taken. Others think that these actions are just grasping at straws. Some people believe that we can take proactive approaches to save plants and animals. For example, panda has once been taken as dangerous distinctive species, but with the effort of many zoologists, pandas are being transfered to a much safer environment, such as the zoo, witch can insure the conservation of them. Now, we can see pandas in zoos all around the world, the number of pandas are surely secured.

On the other hand, some people say that such actions can never keep up with the damages made by human. Some disruptions are irreversible, like the ozone hole, it takes centuries for it to recover. Before that, animals and plants may suffer from drought and forest fire. Moreover, according to Darwin’s Natural Selection, it is quite natural for animals to die out. Dinosaurs become extinct because of the volcano explosion, and it is unnatural to preserve them or even bring them back to life. We surely don’t want to see such horrible nightmares like the movie Jurassic Park to happen in real life.

In conclusion, some people nowadays engage in environmental events, and devoted themselves to protect the living creatures on earth. While some only take passive actions. I believe that although there are chances that these protective actions are useless, we should’t give up on doing so. If we don’t give it a try, we will never know what we can accomplish.

prompt: Human activities have negative effects on plants and animal species. Some people think that it is too late to do anything about this problem. Other people believe that effective measures can be taken to improve this situation. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
Environmental conservation has become a trending topic in recent years. Pessimists claim that there is nothing that can be done to save the Earth, while others argue that human beings still have a chance to modify the situation. In my view, I agree with the latter and I will provide an explanation with examples.

First of all, it is undeniable that human activities have brought a number of serious problems to the Earth due to the increase in human demands based on populations. For instance, the average temperature has increased one Celsius since the 1800s, which mainly caused by deforestation, farming and burning fossil fuels. This leads to a threat to many Arctic species such as polar bears in particular as their habitat is melting and disappearing.

On the other hand, others including me believe there is still hope because the awareness of environmental protection and sustainable development has raised in recent decades. To be more precise, many countries have started to tackle the negative effects brought by human beings, like reducing overexploitation of natural resources. Instead, professionals are researching and finding other renewable and Eco-friendly resources to limit the demands on fuels. Besides, afforestation is encouraged to offset the damage by deforestation. China is one of the best examples, which the overall forest coverage rate has risen from twelve per cent in the early 1980s to twenty-three per cent currently. As a result, the air quality in China has improved dramatically compared with thirty years ago.

In conclusion, even if human activities have caused grave consequences and even some permanent damage to our plants and wildlife, it is not completely irretrievable as long as human beings can learn from previous mistakes and insist on sustainable development.

prompt:
Some people think that children should be taught at school to recycle

materials and avoid waste. Other people believe that children should be taught

this at home.

Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay:
It is often argued that schools should own the responsibility to give awareness among youngsters about goods recycling and waste depletion whilst others disagree and thinks that homes are considered as a better learning place for kids for such education. While primary educational institutes are considered to be the initial learning place for growing minds, I believe that parents' and grandparents' contributions can not be neglected. In this essay, I will discuss in favour of school rather than the living place as a suitable land for children to understand the importance of recycling and discourage waste production with relevant examples.

 There is no doubt that kids always follow what they see in their daily routines. Kids spend 65% of their time in homes which gives them an opportunity to mingle with family members. As a result, their learning is based on observations. Parents and others should follow the practice of recycling disposals and garbage reduction. Such materials are but not limited to; Card boxes & Plastics. For example, a number of youtube channels are available that convey a plethora of ideas about recycling such as wastage and because of the hectic routine of the elder generation, kids are often provided with a variety of electronic devices that keep them engaged. As a consequence, they learn with fun at home with their best interest.

On the hand, Schools are another professional hub for the young generation equipped with modernized facilities that make learning more interesting. I believe that courses can be designed to make recycling and waste prevention a compulsory subject. Setup the special labs that illustrate the types of reusable materials, the process of recycling, and the reduction in litter production could develop a sense of maturity among children at an early age. For instance, The Kenedy School in Brisbane is well known for its achievement in making the world's first prototype of the recycling process together with waste depletion techniques. However, it comes at a massive cost. 

 

To recapitulate, it is vital for children to learn about reusable products and the reduction in the generation of disposals. However, the part played by early educational institutes in this regard outweighs the knowledge transferred by inhabitants as school facilities significantly impact their learning process.

prompt:
Some people think it would be beneficial for school children to study international news as a school subject, while others argue it would be a waste of time.

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
essay:
It is commonly known that many species have gone extinct throughout history, including the dinosaurs. Some argue that preventing extinction is not necessary, as it is a natural process. However, I believe that humans have a moral obligation to protect endangered species and prevent their extinction.

Firstly, human activities such as deforestation, overfishing, and pollution have caused a rapid decline in animal populations, leading many species to be at risk of extinction. As a result, humans have a responsibility to conserve the environment and prevent further harm to wildlife. It is unfair for humans to cause the extinction of a species due to their actions, particularly when they have the ability to prevent it.

Another reason is that many species play a crucial role in maintaining the balance of the ecosystem. For example, bees are essential pollinators that are responsible for pollinating 80% of flowering plants, and thus if bees were to become extinct, it would have a devastating impact on our food supply and ecosystem. Similarly, the loss of predators can cause a ripple effect, leading to overpopulation of other species and causing imbalances in the food chain.

Lastly, preventing extinction is not only a matter of responsibility but also a matter of morality. Species have intrinsic value, and it is not our place to determine which species should exist and which should not. Humans must respect the inherent value of all life forms and do what they can to protect them.

In conclusion, while extinction may be a natural process, it is not a justification for humans to sit idly by and watch as countless species go extinct. By taking action to conserve the environment, humans can ensure that future generations can enjoy the same diversity of life that we have today.

prompt: Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. What do you think? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
There is a public debate on whether middle schools should have a subject about global news, while some people argue about it. Recently, many big issues have happened all around the world. Especially, the ongoing war between Ukraine and Russia is very sad news for everyone. I personally believe that students need to learn about what is going on outside of their countries during school time. This essay discusses the advantages and disadvantages of creating such a subject at secondary schools and my opinion will be provided. 

 I opine that international news classes are essential for the following reason. Learning about the topic associated with other countries leads students to expanding their perspectives. To illustrate, an international school in Tokyo where students come from various countries originally have a unique class in which kids take one topic and discuss it from a a cultural and regional point of view. As a result, students can get different ways of thinking and one of the graduates becomes the CEO of the biggest IT company. Exposure to contemporary affairs from a young age makes them become global citizens who are needed to think of things from a variety of perspectives.

On the other hand, it has a negative aspect as well. A potential disadvantage of this subject is that overseas affairs sometimes contain strong political and religious aspects. Education for kids is supposed to be away from politics and religion because they might affect who they are. For example, children in Iran, where they are taught to be soldiers at school, believe what is taught, therefore they  are fighting as a soldier without any doubt. Hence, global news including such things might affect who they are.

 In conclusion, I believe that the advantages of learning about international news as one of the subjects outweigh the drawbacks that it might bring. I suggest that secondary schools should set such a subject in a curriculum in order to make students exposed to various issues in the world, however, educators need to be careful about the negative aspect.

essay:
A few people feel that food science should be added to school curriculum whereas others opine that preference should be given to learning other important subjects such as maths and science. In my opinion, it is crucial for children to understand) the benefits of food and learn cooking in school as knowledge about food will help them remain / stay healthy throughout their life and also cooking is a basic skill which everyone should learn from their early days.

As children easily get influenced by their teachers it would be a good idea to make them learn the importance of the right food in school. This is because nowadays social media and television are full of advertisements related to unhealthy food options. So, if a child is aware of food science and how nutritious food would keep their body fit, that would encourage them to choose correct food habits. In addition, cooking is a necessity and should be taught to everyone. The curriculum should have a subject such as home science where students can be taught how to prepare their own food. It would motivate them to indulge themselves in home-cooked food instead of spending money on junk food available in markets.

Others who think school days should be used for learning important subjects such as maths and science would argue that these subjects help students in making successful careers later in life. Moreover, in their view, teaching students to learn cooking would distract them from the main subjects. This might lead to students performing poorly in important career-making subjects. However, in today’s time when childhood obesity is being very common, incorporating food science as a subject in the school curriculum might help in curbing this issue. Also, there should be just one or two hours a week for learning to cook. This way, it will have no impact on children’s focus on core subjects.

To conclude, in my opinion, along with important career-making subjects, students should be taught the science of food as it will encourage them to pursue a healthy lifestyle.

prompt: Some people believe that holidays are necessary for students, others think that children should not have holidays because it is just a waste of time. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, it  is a moot issue whether children should have holidays or not. It is  believed by a lot of individuals that it shouldn't be, others think that it's just a waste of time,however.From my perspective, it is necessary that children have some free time from their work so, they could relax or learn something new that they haven't yet.

Learning something new that is not related to  academics is the thing that is quite beneficial for them. Since If they would have some time from their main studies that they are having, then they learn something different activities and learn some skills: public speaking cooking time management and so on, which would be beneficial in that they later live especially for take any job and to interact with others.

Have time for recreational activities is another merit of having vacations. It is generally seen that by learning their academics  for a whole year continuously, they get rid of it. So they want some time for them. For instance, many pieces of research proved that if children devote some of their time to activities that help them to be relaxed then it would be better for them as they could perform much better in the exams. 

To conclude, as vacation has a lot of advantages such as they come up with an opportunity to have knowledge about different things that they want to do and relaxation, that are the major ones and because of them, I think that Vacations  should be promoted instead of restriction.

prompt:

essay:
Nowadays, there is a highly debate about whether art should remain as a crucial subject at school or not.Some people admit that art should be considerd as one of the compulsory subjects school curriculum because it help to enhance students imagination and release stress.On the other hand, some individuals opine that art is not worth for pupils' time since they should put more afford and concentrate on the main subjects.Personally, I sided with the opinion that art should be taught at school. 

To begin with, children will have space to develop their ideas and imagination through pieces of art they creted, they are able to express the emotions,thoughts and creativities through their work which cure them from depression and stress.This happened because kids perceived art as a subject with 'no right and wrong' answer, so they are allowed to be themselves as much as they desire. Furthermore,it is another helpfut alternative for them to discover themselves before they stepped in to the real world.For instance, the recent study showed that the average pupils chose Art for their major in universities rose dramatically in the past decades.

On the contrary, individauls may claim that kids ought to focus and put an extra afford on other important question such as Math,Science or International launguages.Therefore, they will have more oppotunity to widen their acdemic skills for their further study; which will lead them to several stable and high income occupations.For example, students who are eligible for pursuing a doctor degree need to get high scores on both Science and Math, this mean they. need to study harder to achive the achievement

In conclution,despite the perspective of believing that art is a waste of pupils's time,I firmly believe that Art should be a compulsary subject in school's curriculum due to the fact that it broaden children imagination and disminish their depression.
