prompt:
Some people think that art is essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
essay:
In recent years, the question of whether art should be taught at school has been a matter of debate. Some maintain that art should be an integral part of the study; however, there is another school of thought which dismisses this notion as they deem that it is the dissipation of time. In this essay, I will discuss both assertions and conclude that it is of paramount importance.

The most powerful argument in favour of art being on the school curriculum is its profoundly positive impact on the development of children’s cognitive skills. By participating in art activities, children deploy a wide range of accomplishments, like decision-making, thereby enhancing them. Not only can art help children have a fertile imagination, but also promotes lateral thinking in them. It can, therefore, have far-reaching implications, as this expertise are also crucial to learning other subjects; hence it appears logical to suggest that art improve outcomes in all subjects.

Notwithstanding  these substantial benefits, it seems this subject is of no consequence to some. They point out schools should prioritise core subjects, like physics, arguing STEM skills are vital for students’ future lives and art is worthless. Given the fact that not all pupils have the opportunity to pursue their interest in art academies or at home, was art excluded from the school curriculum, they would not be able to understand the value of the arts, nor would those who are artistically inclined hone their skills. 

In conclusion, I subscribe to the theory that art should be a part of the curriculum in view of the fact art education is critical to students’ personal and educational development, and it is inextricably linked to other disciplines as it can foster those skills also needed for them.

prompt:
Some people think that children should be taught at school to recycle materials and avoid waste. Other people believe that children should be taught this at home.

Discuss both opinions and give your own opinion.
essay:
In recent times, it is paramount to recycle plastic bags, bottles etc. To reduce the wastage of natural and man-made resources and to improve its usefulness. Many people argue that children should learn this skill of recycling objects at school, while others insist that parents should teach this to their children.  I admit that parents can act as a guide or mentor, but I firmly believe that in academy students can get practical knowledge also. This essay will discuss both the views by demonstrating facts and points.

To begin with, it is very important to protect the environment from getting polluted. For this, schools can introduce a compulsory subject of waste management in the curriculum. Therefore, children will learn more about it as dedicated time slot will be allocated for exploring this issue. Moreover, children will get hands-on experience and practical knowledge too. It is evident that cognition and intellectual skills are developed more by performing group activities. Peers play a vital role in encouraging and inculcating interest in things which aloof individual finds hard to incur. So, school can act as a channel to motivate its students in reducing the misuse.

On the other hand, kids at home imitate what their parents do. For example, the way parents eat, communicate, etc. Similarly, parents should imbibe the habits of reducing and reusing left over items in themselves, which will be ultimately inherited to the next generation. It has been always stated that home is the first school of the kids. Therefore, parents should indulge their kids in such activities and help then in becoming responsible citizens of the nation. 

 To conclude, parents are the primary source of the knowledge of the kids and what parents can do nobody can do. But, by performing real-time activities with class fellows  can have a long lasting effect on the minds of growing kids.  Thus, they can contribute in a better way in waste management and make this world a better place to live.

prompt: Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. What do you think? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
essay:
The never-ending debate of adding foreign news as one of the subjects of secondary school syllabus is not new. However, the news of overseas current affairs opens the doors for opportunities in indirect ways.   I believe that international news must be a part of the school syllabus for various useful reasons that will be discussed in this essay further. 

Since globalization has arrived and the internet has made everything clear, many students entail a lot of knowledge about world affairs. The growth of efficient organizations in developing countries is opening numerous opportunities for everyone. For example, technology innovations in a country like China are mindblowing, many engineers or technical students from developed countries wish to work in companies situated in China. All these news let the students explore what is going on in the world, and where they can be fitted. Moreover, we all are learning from each other; the success or failure of one country's economy is a lesson for others. For instance, a less peaceful country would look into the reforms of the most peaceful countries - i.e. Newzealand or Canada. Therefore, knowledge lets countries learn from each other. 

Measuring the other benefits; helps students to know about the areas on which the world is competing. Like sports, Television, E-sports and other activities that give countries get power and fame. For example, there are stories of heroes they share online that helps student boost their confidence and morale. Besides, it might help the students in different fields to explore information about their subjects. We can take an example of medical students who can gain knowledge of different disease testing equipment or methods that are used in developed countries. In short, obtaining overseas news opens the intellectual horizons and thoughts of students. 

To summarize, I would suggest that students should know what is happening around the world so that they should adapt to positive change in their life. In my opinion, international news lets students learn practically; whereas, bookish knowledge becomes hard to apply in practical life without examples.

prompt:
Some people think that secondary school children should study international news as one of the school subjects. Other people think that it is a waste of valuable school time. 
Discuss both views.
essay:
When considering what to be taught in secondary school, people are still divided about whether international news should be one of the official subjects or not. While there are benefits to adding this new channel into the classroom, there are also good reasons why it might be helpful to only focus on current curricula. 
The statement that international news should be studied at secondary school is strong for several reasons. In terms of social view, it would help students to gain a wider perspective of the world. In this way, youngsters can be widely acknowledged with current affairs so that they could be aware of how to behave properly. Moreover, in the education view, international news accompanied by different academic subjects such as science, literature, mathematics would complete the integrated learning, which provides students with a full development to lead their life in the future. It is, therefore, clear that global updating plays a vital role in assisting education
On the other hand, it is also understandable that including international news as a subject in secondary school curricula is definitely irrelevant. First, students are now snowed with a hectic schedule, which may result in overloading if any additions. Moreover, in the current education system, especially examination, it places a great emphasis on academic subjects, if students don’t concentrate enough on these qualifications, they might fail. Secondly, the violence represented in many of today's news could affect students' performance. This is because, at the secondary school’ age, students are still inexperienced to understand those negative aspects. So the youngsters tend to misjudge the situations and act inappropriately. Therefore, the study of international news would be a destructive and wasteful use of school resource.
In conclusion, there are convincing arguments for the study of global news into secondary school, but it is also reasonable that it shouldn’t add to be an official subject.

**Task Achievement:**
- The essay adequately addresses the task by presenting both views on the topic and providing relevant arguments.

prompt:
Some people think that art is an essential subject for children at school while others think it is a waste of time.
Discuss both views and give your opinion
essay:
People have different views about whether art should become one of important subjects for the youth or not. While many arguments assume that learning about art at school is time consuming, others are on the contradicting view. Personally, I would contend that art should be taught in optional courses.
On the one hand, there are some reasons for the idea of removing art classes from school’s schedule. One realistically cogent reason is that art is not an essential skill for life survival. People still can find a job and earn for living without an art talent. In fact, there are not many job opportunities for artists compared with other common sectors, hence, some parents would incline to equip their children with academic knowledge rather than art techniques so that kids’ future would be guaranteed with an easier and brighter career path. Therefore, it is not unreasonable for those who consider that spending time for these subjects is such a waste resulting in their intention of the cancellation.
On the other hand, there are some points of view that support the necessary of art courses in school. It can be seen that practicing art activities could develop the young generation’s creativities. Besides, initial art classes could help children explore their passion and ability, thereby gradually germinate and evolve their talent. Moreover, a few hours of learning art could be able to help children relax after other academic subjects.
However, to my mind, although there are both merits and drawbacks of art courses, they should not be completely removed or become an essential subject. I believe some kids enjoy doing art, others might feel uncomfortable. Hence, I would like to suggest that school can make these courses optional. It should depend on the youth to decide to participate in or not.
In conclusion, there are pros and cons for spending time for art in school, nevertheless, everyone deserve to freely make their own decision for how they spend in education stage.
evaluation:
## Task Achievement:
The essay adequately addresses the task by discussing both views on the inclusion of art in school curricula and providing a personal opinion. The ideas presented are relevant to the topic, and the candidate has attempted to cover all aspects of the task. prompt: Some people say that economic growth is the only way to end hunger and poverty, while others say that economic growth is damaging environment so it must be stopped. Disscuss both view and give your opinion?
essay:
Is developing economy harmful to the environment or saving our land from being destroyed constantly by human ignorance and greed?  The answer is positive.

In recent years, extreme environmentalists acclaimed that their activities, including protesting and advocating for conservation and improvement are the best way to avoid our planet being damaged inevitably. Other people argued that the growing economy would resolve the problems of scarcity and starvation, which are the real causes of environmental destructing somehow nowadays.

Firstly, starvation and scarcity of resource are important issues in our world, but resolving these problems are not standing on the opposite side of environmental protection. They are not topics in the same category. The efforts striving to improve the prosperity of society aren't meant it's damaging our nature,  but for which, is now being protected by lots of advanced technics attributed to economic growth. For example, in Ning Xia, a province of northwest China, local peasants have benefited from the increasing economy and technologies and can have better measures to protect grasslands. 

On the other hand, ending hunger and poverty, along with protecting the environment, which one is the prior issue? For some perspective of environmentalists, the best earth is a world without any human species. There would be no hunger and poverty issues if human beings never existed before. That is ridiculous. The environment is not a stationary object that never changed since the birth of our mother planet. It doesn't need to worry about our world excessively, because it has experienced so many extinctions and rebirths after numerous catastrophes and keeping vibrant now.

In conclusion, promoting economic development is not only the method to end starvation and poverty problems, but also the best way to protect our environment. Furthermore, the whole of nature would be benefited from our new technologies generated by economic growth.

Many people argue that environmental issues are needed to be solved strictly by the government's policy of increasing the cost of private vehicles. Personally, it is a useful measure, but other measures might be more effective.

There are some underlying reasons why authorities should make an effort to raise petrol prices. Firstly,  it would limit the number of car journeys and the money raised could be used to improve public transport. Because of the sharp rise in appearance and convenience of cars, humans forget the harmfulness of using their vehicles related to the environment. Therefore, the government should upgrade and expand public transport provided by the cost of private vehicle users. Moreover, more goods would travel by rail. It is clear that freight services and the useful solution former would reduce vehicle emissions and the greenhouse effect.

Apart from the practical measures mentioned above, I believe that other solutions are more effective. There are more and more traffic jams happening on the road daily, especially during rush hours. In this situation, congestion charges should be the best idea to improve transport infrastructure.For instance, London's government used this method to avoid traffic congestion influenced directly by transport facilities. Additionally, free bus and train passes are other measures that helped to reduce the use of cars and improve air quality. Local authorities should subsidize the cost of fares to encourage people in using public transport. 

In conclusion, it seems to me that it's useful to raise taxes on petrol, but other transport measures would be more effective to help the environment.

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The world is now surrounded by many urgent environmental problems, and many people feel that raising the cost of fuel is one of the most effective ways of combatting them. Although I tend to agree with this viewpoint, I believe there are other environmental measures that need to be taken. 

Increasing petrol prices would help save the environment in many ways. As the number of vehicles on the roads is increasing dramatically, so is the amount of vehicular emissions released into the atmosphere. However, if governments increase fuel costs, this solution would serve as a deterrent for people who drive their private cars, reducing air pollution and ozone layer depletion. Besides discouraging people from driving their private cars, this would also generate income to make further investments in environmental initiatives. Given these potential benefits of raising fuel prices, is it hardly surprising to see so many countries applying it to practice.

Apart from increasing the cost of fuel, we can also implement other solutions to environmental issues. For instance, on an individual level, people who want to help the environment should become more environmentally responsible by buying eco-friendly products, and reusing and recycling plastic bags. They can also take public transport as opposed to their personal cars, which produce toxic fumes. From a government’s perspective, it is essential to switch to green energy sources, such as solar and wind, rather than continuing to rely on gas and petrol. Thus, environmental protection goes beyond just raising fuel prices. 

In conclusion, though I attach great importance to the practice of increasing fuel costs, I think that both individuals and governing bodies should become environment-oriented in their mindset to tackle environmental problems.

Increasing the price of fuel for cars and other vehicles is proposed to be one of the best ways to mitigate the issues in our environment. However, in my opinion, I am absolutely in disagreement with this statement. The reasons for this will be tackled in this essay.

First of all, increasing the price of fuel will only have a minimal impact on protecting our environment from pollution or climate change and will have a significant rebound negative impact on an individual level and on microenterprises. This will cause financial strain for the less fortunate, while the wealthy and large-scale business owners will most likely be unaffected. For these reasons, there will be a clash of temperaments and an increasing poverty level for those affected and could possibly lead to other issues like a rise in looting and crime rates.

Furthermore, there are other effective ways to address environmental issues, such as increasing the use of renewable energy and encouraging the use of recyclable materials.By doing such things, society can benefit more as recyclables are a more practical way of saving money. Furthermore, making use of our renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and water energy will help reduce the amount of fossil fuel circulating in the atmosphere. Thus, this will help aid in protecting our nature.

To summarize, repricing crude is not a practical or optimal solution to the environmental issues we face today. It will only hurt the poor and benefit the rich, which could create tension and, worse, lead to other societal issues such as a rise in crime rates. It is then imperative to consider the use of renewable sources of energy to conserve and aid the earth from pollution and climate change by reducing the amount of fossil fuel accumulation.

prompt: People think that goverments should increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles to solve envinronmental problems. Give your opinion
essay:
It is certainly true that one solution to address environmental issues would be for the governments to raise the prices of petrol . Although i consider that this might be an effective measure, i believe that other measures have even more profound impacts. 


On the one hand, there are a variety of reasons why increasing the fuel prices is beneficial in addressing some of the environmental problems . Firstly, in terms of private cars, when the national authorities raise the taxes on petrol, motorists will have to limit the time and length of their journey. Therefore, governments will have more money to reinforce and update the public transport provision, as people still need to go the office, school or other medical health services like hospital, for example. Secondly, from the perspective of the freight services, more goods are transported by rail instead of truck. Thus, Both these measures will cut down on emissions and reduce the greenhouse effects. 


On the other hand, while this rise in fuel prices might be a stopgap measure, governments can adopt other policies which may be more effective in the long term. For instance, the local authorities in London have introduced a congestion charge on all vehicles visiting the city central. As a result, they have subsidized their money on some health awareness campaigns and spending on the transport infrastructure. In turn, there is a general decline in exhaust fumes from vehicles around the city centre and the air quality in the city has improved by this action.  Another policy could be to establish some free bus and train routes, as the increased use of public transport will alleviate pollution from private cars and help in the effort to combat global warming.


In conclusion, a sharp rise in petrol prices can be a useful environmentally friendly transport measure, although in the long term other steps will be more valuable

prompt: Some people think that one of the best ways to solve environmental problems is to  increase the cost of fuels for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree  with this statement?
essay: Over the past decades, environmental problems have never failed to draw public attention  and provoke debates. Although the severity and urgency of addressing environmental  problems properly are hardly arguable, the issue as to whether governments should deal with  these issues with higher price of fuels or not remains controversial. From my own perspective,  I consider this approach is ineffective.  Firstly, it is important to recognize that although the occurrence of positive outcome towards environment is almost inevitable, the final result may not be as expected for long. Some may  hold optimistic attitude that this particular approach would be the effect on limiting the  number of cars and thereby reducing the amount of environment-damaging gas emission. This  argument could be true to some extent. However, they should take into account the fact that  since the cost of public transport would also be affected, resistance in people with the need of  travel seems to be inevitable, hence the impossibility of achieving the desired goal. Therefore,  increasing fuel prices will not make any significant changes.  Secondly, it is equally important to recognize that there is evidence that waste gas from cars is  not the leading cause of air pollution. The opponents may argue that the combustion of fossil  fuels by cars is the main producer of carbon dioxide. Nevertheless, they are ignorant of the fact  that the chef culprit is the discharge of pollutants into the atmosphere due to the rapidly growing  manufacturing industry. Governments could better handle this problem if they could increase  control over industrial waste-discharge and adopt more environmental friendly materials and  production equipment. For example, wind and tidal power in the Netherlands, nuclear power in  Japan and solar power in the United States have all proven their efficiency  in energy  production. This example indicates that other solutions could be employed in other parts of the  world to minimize the global dependence on fossil fuel.  In conclusion, under no circumstances should increasing the price of fuels be taken as the best  solution to environmental issues, as it has neglected both the reaction of consumers and the  root cause of the problem as mentioned above.

Government can raise expenditure on upgrading and expand public facilities and transportation to suffice residents. 
On the other hand, while this rise in petrol costs might be a useful stopgap measure, national authorities could apply some other solutions to tackle this problem. The first measure is to invest money in developing eco-friendly means of transport. People should be encouraged to use electric cars and motorbikes to prevent air pollution. Moreover, introducing free bus and train passes, as the increased use of public transport would help in the effort to combat global warming. Another measure is to raise people awareness of the need to cut down on emissions from their cars. Environmental campaigns shoud be carried out more, especially on social media to popularize residents efficient ways to protect the environment. 
In conclusion, a sharp rise in petrol prices would be a useful environmental friendly transport measure, although in the longer term other steps would be more effective.

Some people think that the best way to solve global environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel.

It is believed by some people that increasing the prices of the fuel is the key to solving environmental problems. In my opinion, I completely agree with this statement.  Firstly, this essay will discuss on how this decision can reduce the emissions of dangerous gases releasing into the air and secondly, explain how it can decrease the overall consumption of this resource utilized by human beings for industrial purposes.
Increasing the price of fuel can reduce the number of vehicles travelling on the streets. This can prevent in emission of greenhouse gases, particularly from vehicles into the air and as a result, it reduces overall pollution, which is also one of the primary  contributing factors in environmental issues. For example, the United Kingdom has recently surged the prices of the fuel and it resulted in lesser traffic and even showed significant difference in the air quality due to lesser hazardous gases released. Therefore, it is clear that increasing the cost can actually make a difference to tackle this problem.
Another reason to consider inclining the prices of the fuel would directly reflect in the reduction of all other industries using fuel as a primary energy source. In other words, several industries use diesel and gas as a primary source of energy to provide electricity to their machines and now people will double check on spending hefty amounts which will eventually reduce the excess consumption of this resource and therefore look for renewable ways to run their machines. It is therefore playing a prominent role in tackling the contributing factors of environmental problems. Hence, it is patently evident that hiking the costs of the fuel is beneficial to the society.
In conclusion, surging the prices of the fuel can tackle environmental problems as it reduces the vehicles that emit gasses into the atmosphere and overall reduction of its consumption which are powering up machines. It is recommended that more and more countries should take this initiative for a better healthy air in the world.

prompt:
Some people think the best way to solve environmental problems is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles.
To what extent, do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is commonly believed by many that inflating the cost of fuel is the most efficient way to solve environmental issues. I partially agree with them because I believe that although it is an important way but there are many other more effective ways of doing so.

On one hand, increase in the rate of fuel would definitely reduce the level of pollution to some extent. As increased rate will discourage people to use their vehicles unnecessarily, as it is a common trend to drive a car even though the distance is walkable. This will encourage people to use pooling of vehicle while going to same site. For instance, if five people from one community work in same office or location, it is the efficient to go by one car alternatively. This will also motivate them to use bicycles and public transport system. Thus, this will solve the problem to some extent.

On the other hand, I believe this is not the key method and there are many other effective ways to solve environmental issues such as growing more trees and avoid use of plastic bags. Plastic containers should be replaced by bio-degradable glass dishes. Also I believe that this change would provide some level of discomfort to the public as the public transport system in most of the countries are not very convenient. In short, only increasing the rate of fuel would not protect the environment, people have to become conscious about the surrounding and put their contribution by many other ways such as aforementioned.

In conclusion, I agree that inflated rates of fuel would decrease the environmental problems but it is not the most efficient way, as it will benefit the environment but may provide inconvenience to public. Only increasing the rate of fuel would not improve the adverse condition of our environment, many other measures need to be taken such as planting trees, choosing glass over plastic and using renewable resources instead of fossil fuels.

prompt: Some people believe that the government should not spend money on international aid when they have their own disadvantaged people like homeless and unemployed. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some individuals suppose that the government should allocate financial resources to other impoverished countries while others believe that it is of paramount importance to focus on solving their domestic issues. From my point of view, I strongly agree with the proposal of determining national priority on internal problems.

On the one hand, it is undeniable that cross-border support is a symbol of humanity. Geographically, people are divided into different ethnicities but by nature, it will be the core of connecting features among individuals. Thus, aiding the poor stems from the consciousness and heart of each resident and is not solely contingent on monetary contributions. Not to mention that helping other nations to encounter  financial crises would eliminate the chances of illegal migration which is detrimental to surrounding developed regions. For example, back to the COVID-19 pandemic, with  assistance from the whole world related to foods, vaccines,... etc, leading to a sustainable society as well as expressing humanity among several nations.

Nevertheless, I am of the opinion that concentrating on addressing domestic issues such as homelessness or unemployment should be of the utmost urgency in any country. To begin with, the financial fund from the government is regarded as a crucial means to reserve and maintain welfare schemes as well as social security. The smooth flow of how society works would generate a favourable environment for employment opportunities which accordingly increases the economic growth rate. Furthermore, employment prospects, consequently, generate more personal budgets which people can use to afford decent accommodation decreasing the homelessness rate.

In conclusion, although transnational support should be executed as a gesture of humanity, I still believe that the government should put the goal of tackling internal issues in a country to be the top priority.

prompt: Some people believe that the government should not spend money on international aid when they have their own disadvantaged people like homeless and unemployed. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Over the last 100 years, population has grown at an exponential rate across many countries in the world. This brings along with it its own problems such as poverty, illiteracy, unemployment and so on. Many governments allocate huge resources to tackle these problems. Since all governments have problems to solve in their own countries, I agree with the argument that their first priority should be their own people.

There are ample reasons why I believe that the government should put the welfare of its own people ahead of others. To begin with, financial resources are becoming scarce and many countries are already in debt. These funds must be reserved for the development and maintenance of its own institutions and social security measures such as free health care and shelters for homeless people. Secondly, such welfare schemes not only elevate people out of poverty; they also help the government indirectly by creating jobs. This, in turn, facilitates the economic growth of the country.

On the other hand, it is understandable and reasonable to donate money to the poorer nations as a gesture of basic human decency and humanity. No nation, after all, can live in prosperity when its neighbours are struggling with poverty. By offering financial assistance to their poor neighbours, countries can also put a curb on illegal immigration. Even so, in my opinion, solving problems in one’s own country is more important than venturing to help others. Others should be helped only when the donating country has a surplus of money and resources.

In conclusion, there are obvious benefits for the government in the long run from donating money as relief aids to many foreign countries. However, I strongly iterate that the government must first improve the economic, financial and employment prospects of its own people before embarking on humanitarian work abroad.

prompt: Some people believe that it is the government’s responsibility to provide care and finance to support people after they retire. Others, however, think that individuals themselves should save money in their own when they are old. Discuss both views and give your opinion. > DISCUSS AND OPINION
essay:
Some people believe that the government should take care of old people and provide financial support after they retire. Others say individuals should save during their working years to fund their own retirement. What is your opinion? Give reasons for your answer and include examples from your own experience.

It is true that when people advance into their golden years, they require more help and attention. For that reason, a significant number of people hold the opinion that the government should provide financial assistance to the elderly. However, I tend to agree with those who argue that workers should be saving a portion of their income to have a nest egg in their retirement.

To begin with, a culture of saving rather than depending on the government may foster the overall economic development of a country. In other words, if people were to accumulate their own savings for their pension age, it would lessen the financial burden on the government. As a result, the government would be able to release more funds to more productive purposes, such as development of infrastructure, industries, hospitals, and so on, which may expedite the overall progression of a country.

In addition to economic factors, putting money aside has some personal benefits. Since savings-oriented people are not dependent on the state for their living expenses, this may instill a sense of self-respect and pride in them. On the other hand, those who are reliant on financial assistance very often face the negative societal stigma, as many people consider them to be inferior and unworthy members of society. Hence, to live a life with dignity and pride, taking responsibility for funding one’s own retirement is evidently a better option from individual perspective.

prompt: Some people think that the main purpose of schools is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people are of the opinion that the primary role of schools is to create good citizens, instead of merely working towards individual betterment. During the course of this essay, this statement would be subjected to objective discussion before drawing a rational conclusion. 

Obviously, there are a plethora of reasons to support the given perspective; nevertheless, the value of a well-functioning society seems to be the most widely accepted. As contemporary society moves into a phase of rapid developments in medicine, technology, welfare and so on, the luxury of conformity requires people to sacrifice their individualism for common prosperity.  To be specific, individuals are expected to function harmoniously to both stimulate the economy and preserve the peaceful existence amongst communities. As much as these prerequisites require education, school is where this education can initiate. In many educational institutions, teachers have the power to both openly and subconsciously influence students’ socially responsible actions and provide them with a solid foundation for future employment.

On the other hand, this perspective should not be considered an ideal one. As a result of following their own ostensibly selfish goals, students who are taught to share, work effectively in teams, and enhance their talents can benefit society. In addition, it’s possible that occasionally the emphasis on society may come at the expense of people’s mental health. For instance, pupils who are instructed to keep their personal opinions to themselves in class, as is typical in many authoritarian countries, could harbour anger and feel unable to properly express themselves in a democratic setting. According to cognitive science, the ability to express oneself without worrying about negative consequences or repercussions is essential for well-rounded development.

In conclusion, while there is a case to be made for societal stability, schools should work to develop strong, motivated students. Naturally, these objectives do not conflict with one another, and it is important to highlight the overlap.
evaluation:
### Task Achievement: **7**
- The candidate has addressed the given task by providing a balanced discussion on the extent to which schools should prioritize the development of good citizens over individual benefit.
- The ideas presented are relevant to the topic and support the candidate's position.
- All aspects of the task have been covered, including the arguments for and against the given perspective.
- The essay demonstrates a clear understanding of the task requirements.

### Coherence and Cohesion: **7**
- The essay is well-organized and ideas flow smoothly between paragraphs.
- Transitions and connecting words are used effectively to maintain a logical progression of thoughts.
- The information is presented in a coherent manner, with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion.

### Lexical Resource (Vocabulary): **7**
- The candidate demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and uses words appropriately in the context.
- Some errors in vocabulary are present, such as "well-functioning" instead of "well-functioning" and "ostensibly" instead of "ostensibly."
- Overall, the vocabulary used enhances the clarity and effectiveness of the essay.

### Grammatical Range and Accuracy: **7**
- The candidate uses a variety of sentence structures, demonstrating grammatical complexity.
- There are some minor grammatical errors, such as "is essential for well-rounded development" instead of "are essential for well-rounded development."
- Overall, the grammatical accuracy of the essay does not hinder its readability or understanding.

### Overall Band Score: **7**
- The essay meets the requirements of the task effectively.
- It is well-organized, coherent, and demonstrates a good range of vocabulary and grammar.

prompt:
Some people think the main purpose of school is to turn children into good citizens and workers, rather than to benefit them as individuals.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
The young generation of each country is its main part contributing to the future of that country. Schools as the second home of children have a significant role in their lives; as a result, there is a widely accepted belief which says they are only responsible to provide the future law-abiding citizens and productive workers. On the contrary, there is another hypothesis against that which points out that schools should concentrate on students' happiness and personal growth regardless of the society and professional market requirements. I believe to some extent both ideas are correct and the right way is to utilize both ideas at the same time.

On the one hand, a proportion of people agree schools have to provide both educational and vocational curricula for students to provide the nation with citizens who will behave based on the predefined rules and act proactively in the industry as employees. For example, these days, elementary school pupils are encouraged to join different extra-time classes including sports, dance, science or vocational.

On the other hand, there is an idea against the aforementioned belief which says if kids require to know their mental and physical characteristics first, then they will figure out their talents easily. This idea points  out that playtime is a must-have for children at school and they need to play with other counterparts in school to learn the concept of teamwork naturally. Therefore, they will learn to obey the law and be productive by doing social activities.

In general, there are two hypotheses about the responsibility of schools to nurture students. The first one knows schools are responsible for preparing useful employees and citizens, but the second one mentions children only need to take benefits from schools individually. Although schools have to focus on the personal growth of each child, they need to prepare them for their future professional life as children are the most valuable asset of each nation.
evaluation:

The essay addresses the task by acknowledging the differing viewpoints on the purpose of schools and expressing the candidate's own opinion. However, some aspects of the task are not thoroughly covered. There is a lack of specific examples or evidence to support the claims made in relation to the arguments presented. The essay could benefit from a more detailed exploration of the advantages and disadvantages of each perspective and a clearer explanation of how the two approaches can be balanced.

The essay lacks a clear and logical structure. The ideas are presented in a disjointed manner, making it difficult to follow the flow of thought. The use of vocabulary is not always appropriate, with some words used incorrectly or in an informal manner. The essay could benefit from a wider range of vocabulary and more precise word choices.

Suggested Band Score: 6

The essay contains several grammatical errors, including incorrect verb forms, sentence structure issues, and punctuation mistakes. These errors affect the clarity and readability of the text. The essay would benefit from careful proofreading and attention to grammatical accuracy.

prompt:
2) Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Teenager is a very active phase of life when they have so much curiosity to explore about the world.  In order to utilize that energy in a positive way, I do believe that they need to be involved in a social work as a volunteered. This will help for a community as well as teenagers themselves as it will give them a kind of sense of being worthwhile in a society. Moreover, it is obvious that community will get benefit from it as it will help to build harmonious society.  

There are three reasons why I recommend to include teenagers in unpaid social work. Firstly, when teenagers start working in the community from the early age of their life, they will learn different life skills which will be useful for them in the future. Furthermore, it will help them to gain work experience which will make their life easy to find the job in their adulthood. Moreover, teenagers will feel the sense of being included and being part of the society which help them to grow mentally and physically. Thus, I strongly support to involve teenager in social activities. 

Secondly, encouraging teenagers in social work will help to lower the risk of them getting involved in illegal activities. As teenagers are very curious by the nature to see the world and they can easily influences by other as their articulative ability to distinguise right and wrong is not fully develop, they might choose the wrong way during this stage of life. Therefore, keeping them busy in community work in their free time will help to distract them from making the bad decision in their life. 

Thirdly, involving teenagers in a community volunteer work will set an example for others to be selfless and help each other. Moreover, it will help to build a peaceful, harmonious and cooperative environment in the community. In addition, observeing teenager doing the social work will encourage others to do the volunteer work in future. Furhtermore, teenagers will feel empower, proud and confident being part of the society and being able to bring the change in the community. 

Thus, it is beneficial for both community and teenagers themselves, I would highly recommend them to participate in social activities.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:** 

The candidate has adequately addressed the task by expressing their agreement with the statement that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work. They provide three main reasons to support their stance, including the development of life skills, the reduction of involvement in illegal activities, and the promotion of a positive example for others. prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Some people argue that wages should not be paid for teenage workers who spend their free time on work in the community so that can lead to some beneficial skills to teenagers and also good to the community. In my opinion, This can not be acceptable for youngsters who attempt to live on their own. This essay partially agree with this topic and will discuss both views

On the one hand, It can reduce an expenditure of community organization who works for public without paid as well as it also can contribute youngsters to gain essential skill and social skill which could help them to grow up effectively and can face to a real world. For example, some community group who works for a charity and give all money they earn to a donation for stray dogs. This can be seen as a positive affect to the community, teenagers as well as dogs.

On the other hand, while it can be a positive aspect to teenagers, it also can exhaust them in case it is hard work or some work that requires them to use their force. Besides, youngsters can be distracted from their classes by this work and they would think that it is not worth participating in public work.

To conclude, It could depend on how hard they have to work and these both views could have beneficial positive effects to young people and even community organization.

prompt: Some people believe that teenager should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time . This can be benefit teenagers and the community as well . To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There are a lot of young people who go to do unpaid community work after school. Some people think that it is good for both young people and the community. My view is that unpaid community jobs can provide teenagers and the community with a lot of advantages. 

 

First, it is obvious that young people can have a good experience for doing community work. This is because they need to learn how to communicate with different kinds of people who are living in this community and how to work together. So they can learn something different that is not from books. 

 

Moreover, young people can build a good relationship with other people. For example, young people can meet with other people who are in the similar age and they can make friends easier after working together. Therefore, young people should have more friends in the same area and have a better memory. 

 

On the other hand, the government can save money for the community because young people can do some community job for free. For instance, teenagers can clean the community’s park regularly, so that the government can spend less money on it. Moreover, the government can use that money to organize some activities for public.  

 

In summary, I think that it is good for teenagers to attend some different events of community work without pay, which will be a good experience for them in the future. So, it is good for parents to encourage their young kids to do some community jobs.

prompt:
Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid
work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this
would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Many youngsters work on a volunteer basis, and this can truly be conducive for both the community and themself; however, from my perspective, I disagree with the viewpoint that all teenagers should be forced to do unpaid work in their leisure time.

One evident reason that supports my idea is that students are already stressed and tired enough during their school hours; therefore , they should be allowed to rest and enjoy their leisure time in lieu of being asked to do unpaid work. Forcing students to do such work might further enhance their burden and even lead to a reduction in their academic performance. Another problem is that inefficient work can be anticipated. To exemplify, It can be easily envisaged that people who are compelled to do work  against their will are liable to end up inefficiently; moreover, this action can even exacerbate the relationship between the adolescents and the local community, eventually reaching the outcome which is against the initial expectation.

People who stand on the opposite side might contend that youngsters can cultivate a sense of responsibility through work on a volunteer basis. This can be sensible in some aspects; however, except for being forced to do unpaid work, there are still other gateways for the young to attain the same effect. For example, it is also an act of responsibility for some teenagers who manage their own time to do part-time jobs to support their tuition or personal expenses and ameliorate their families' economical condition. 

In conclusion, I disagree with the view that young people should be required to do unpaid work as many drawbacks can be anticipated. The meaning of volunteer work would be conducive for both sides only if it is not against any individual’s will.

prompt: Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole. Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Numerous young people are involved to work on a volunteer basis. Society thinks that they gain experience for free and should not get any income as they improve their local community. In this essay, I will argue this statement.

Every job, despite its usefulness, must be paid. We have to encourage teenagers by any means for their efforts to develop a productive and prosperous community. In my residential complex, for instance, children receive a discount coupon for a candy shop if they do public work like helping to restore a sporting area or cleaning common spaces. If they were made to work for free, they would not complete all requirements in the best way they can.

Another major reason is that teenagers should spend their spare time for education. We can consider that not only regular school or university visits, but also completing homework are teenagers' duties. It is not arguable that if students have been spending more time learning rather than working, they will grow up to be well-educated and qualified specials. If all my former classmates had studied instead of working, we would have had more benefits to build a wealthy city.

In conclusion, it is up to young people to decide how they would like to be useful for a community, volunteer for free, or study hard to get a degree. I think we have to teach children from the very first step that nothing in the world is for free and they have paid their own leisure time in order to get money or other items they want.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

The essay addresses the given task by discussing the arguments for and against requiring teenagers to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. The candidate provides clear and relevant ideas in response to the task. However, the essay lacks depth and does not adequately cover all aspects of the task. The candidate does not provide strong evidence or examples to support their arguments.

**Suggested Band Score (Task Achievement): 6**

**Coherence and Cohesion:**

The essay is generally coherent and cohesive, with clear transitions between sentences and paragraphs. However, the logical sequence of information could be improved, and some paragraphs could be better connected. The essay would benefit from more effective use of connecting words and phrases.

**Suggested Band Score (Coherence and Cohesion): 6**

**Lexical Resource (Vocabulary):**

The essay demonstrates a limited range of vocabulary, with some inaccuracies and overuse of certain words. The candidate would benefit from using more varied and precise vocabulary.

**Mistakes and Rectified Words:**

* "Every job, despite its usefulness, must be paid." -> "Every job, regardless of its usefulness, should be compensated."
* "they improve their local community" -> "they contribute to their local community"
* "If they were made to work for free, they would not complete all requirements in the best way they can." -> "If they were forced to work unpaid, they may not perform to the best of their abilities."
* "more benefits to build a wealthy city" -> "more resources to create a prosperous city"

**Suggested Band Score (Lexical Resource): 6**

**Grammatical Range and Accuracy:**

The essay demonstrates a basic range of grammatical structures, but there are some errors in sentence construction and punctuation.

**Mistakes and Rectified Sentences:**

* "Every job, despite its usefulness, must be paid." -> "Every job, regardless of its usefulness, should be compensated."
* "If they were made to work for free, they would not complete all requirements in the best way they can." -> "If they were forced to work unpaid, they may not perform to the best of their abilities."
* "If all my former classmates had studied instead of working, we would have had more benefits to build a wealthy city." -> "If all my former classmates had focused on their studies instead of working, we would have had more resources to create a prosperous city."

**Overall Band Score: 6.5**

**Feedback and Additional Comments:**

The essay addresses the task but lacks depth and supporting evidence. The candidate would benefit from using more specific and varied vocabulary, improving grammatical accuracy, and organizing the essay more coherently. The essay could also be strengthened by providing concrete examples to support the arguments presented.

It is debatable that teens should volunteer during their leisure time. Due to the fact, that volunteering can benefit both teenagers and society. I completely agree with the above statement so I will explain my opinion using examples from the United Kingdom and Sri Lanka. 

Youngsters´ participation in unpaid work influences them positively. I will begin with that involving teenagers in volunteering activities converts them to be good-oriented adults in the future. In addition, taking responsibility for these kinds of helping works capable to teach many qualifications, for instance, leadership, task performance, and being more disciplined. As an example, During the UK school children’s gap year, they often volunteer to take after the elderly who need help. Also, Research confirmed the immense impacts of this on improving the participated candidates’ kindness, caring, patience and humility. 

Moreover, teenagers’ volunteer work can empower the development of the communities. Because of having busy teens will end up reducing the number of crimes, robberies, unethical involvements, and sexual harassment. As a piece of evidence, in 2000, criminal activities and rape cases went down immensely, subsequently, after adopting the idea of encouraging Sri Lanka 10-grade- school students to volunteer throughout summer vacation.

In conclusion, it is crystal clear that teenagers’ involvement in unpaid work positively affects them and the community as well. Teenagers often enrich their qualities and experience because of taking part in the volunteer industry. I couldn’t be more agreeable, as I believe that adolescents should participate in different community activities to build their confidence, hence being productive individuals in society.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
It is not unusually to see young people are mandatory for doing housework. Some have argued that the youngers doing work in the association for free in their free time can have advantages both for the community and teenagers. Personally, I completely agree. In this essay, I will explain why this initiative will benefit teenagers and the neighbourhood.

The main reason why the younger should do unpaid community work is that teenagers can have a healthy lifestyle. There is no doubt that young students spending much free time gaming or studying means less time for exercise, and a much more sedentary lifestyle, which can result in chronic diseases such as obesity, heart disease and diabetes. Students will have more opportunities to exercise instead of watching TV or playing video games, for instance, if those works are mandatory for them. The healthier life youngers have, the more chances to do what they want.

In addition, in terms of association, this behaviour will save a lot of money. The neighbourhood does not need to hire more staff because there are lots of youngers doing work for free. For example,  Teenagers can do some easy work such as cleaning and helping old people, which will cost a lot of budgets. Every dollar that can be saved on hiring staff can be invested in infrastructure, which can increase the well-being of habitats. Clearly, this initiative will be a benefit to the association in the long run.

In conclusion, I do believe that compulsory works have many advantages, not only for the younger physically healthy  but also for the development of the community.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent to do agree or disagree?
essay:
Our teenagers nowadays seem to be unresponsible towards their society as they have been occupied by social media feeds. Hence, this is a suggestion to engage them in voluntary jobs to aid their community and improve their skills at the same time. In my perspective, this step could be beneficial for both the nation and adolescent as it will improve his responsibility and his interpersonal skills which could be a life-changer for our offspring.

  As a starting point, when a teenage boy provides services for the elderly for instance, he will appreciate his life in addition to this rewarding satisfaction of helping others. Consequently, this experience will improve his character and will make him willing to help the underprivileged people in his society. Furthermore, this trend will make the children more introverted and interact with their peers to reach  ingenious solutions to the problems which their countries suffer from.

  On the other hand, this voluntary work will teach a valuable lesson to our generation about their duty in their surroundings and will strengthen the bond with the nation. Certainly, when the child will feel that he makes a difference in his community, he will improve this sense of nationality simultaneously. As a consequence, the new generations will be capable of dealing with the emerging obstacles in their countries.   

To conclude,  adolescents spend a lot of their spare time doing trivial activities. So we have to direct them to help their people and make them acquire the appropriate skills by encouraging them to volunteer in community service which will be advantageous for them personally and for society as well.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Teenagers can learn a lot through working in the community in their free time. Many people believe that this can be advantageous to the community and the children because services like picking up garbage and helping elders can teach teenagers to keep the place clean and tidy and respect their elders. I believe, however, that they should be paid for their work and time rather than doing it for free. 

Children do have free time compared to adults. It can motivate them to participate in these activities, utilized time appropriately, and get paid.  In other words, knowing that they will earn through their hard work without even pushing them, they will participate voluntarily. For instance, if a teenager wants to buy pair of sports shoes, he will work in the community and earn that money rather than asking his parents. However, if asked to work for free, they might end up not performing the tasks well. They will find reasons to avoid performing services to the community. When forced to do the job, the outcome might turn out to be poor. For example, when rewarded, the child will be willing to do duty with utmost care. Therefore, it should be compulsory to pay, when they are working in their leisure time.

In conclusion, the community should pay children for working because it will motivate them. In addition, there would not be any need to force them because they will voluntarily participate considering the reward they will earn.

prompt: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
One might think that enforcement of mandatory community service by youths during their free hours will be beneficial to them and the community. I highly disagree with this opinion, because teenagers have the right to choose which skill they want to progress in their free time. In addition to that, community development is the responsibility of the government.

Freedom to select what interesting thing to do on the youths precious time can further motivate them to excel. This is because every person is unique and has various points of preference. It drives them to invest time and focus in achieving certain tasks. A better approach is to present the tasks and programs that can help them hone their present skills. For example youths with anti-social behaviour, it will be unfair for them to be required to work in a community that requires social skills. Anti-social presons can be productive in solitary jobs like computer programming.

Obviously, teenagers development through forced labor in the community will never be productive for them. Since this is carried out in a way that youths dont have a choice, results are expected to be in low compliance. Only a low percentage of this age-group can tolerate uncompensated labor, most of them spends their time in social gatherings, games and even sports. In contrast, youths who work usually would expect to have salaries, as this will be the motivating factor for them to buy their needs and wants at this stage in life. As an example, nowadays, highschoolers are active with social media, they spent a huge number of hours on these platforms, learning, communicating, and at times take advantage to earn extra money, that is why community work will be the least option for them.  

In conclusion, there are much better alternatives in honing the youth, among those options, community required jobs are not the best. Teenagers can be productive and beneficial to the community by doing things where they excel and enjoy the most.

prompt:
Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free time to help the local community. They believe this would benefit both the individual teenager and society as a whole.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Nowadays, there are many people who believe that all teenagers have to take apart in the summer camp for their spare time which can be helpful for their society. They also feel that in general, these materials have played a crucial role on their personality. Despite of this idea, I personally disagree with this notion, hence reasons will be analysed in this article.

In my opinion, it could be a misconception about students and teenagers which are obliged to do an an unpaid job in the summer. First of all, they should have the opportunity to do whatever they want in life. However, if they forced, it may affect on the outcome of their job, because they have done something which they are not eager to do it. Secondly, when students and teenagers attend to school, they have a hectic curriculum which means they do not have adequate time to refresh their mind and peruse on their interest hobbies. Finally, with these situations, if we force them, we will kill their free time.

My idea varies widely with this notion which these obligations would be beneficial both for teenagers and their community. Firstly, by following their ideas, students are forced to do things that are against their will. So as a result, they cannot do their best in their work and after a while they will figure out that they have just wasted their time by doing these unpaid jobs. Therefore, it would not have an impact on their personality. In addition, if they are forced, we will increase the number of people who are depressed or have a lot of problems in their lives. For instance, some researches on some students in the UK indicate that those students which had gone to the summer camp, had a number of issues related to their society after that work.

In conclusion, while teenagers may choose to work for free in their spare time, I believe that we should not make this compulsory.

prompt:
Some people think that all teenagers should be required to do unpaid work in their free 
time to help the local community. They believe this would benefit both the individual 
teenager and society as a whole.
Do you agree or disagree?
essay:
There is an increasingly growing popular belief that young people should be forced to take part in volunteer activities to contribute to the society in their spare time. While I agree with the thought that it is beneficial to both students and the public, I believe that youngsters should not be obliged to do community service without being paid.

On the one hand, there are several benefits of giving young students the added responsibility of doing unpaid work. Firstly, by doing these works, teenagers can accumulate valuable experiences and essential skills for their future career. In addition, they will be given the opportunity to have better resumes, which is useful once they start pursuing higher education or seeking jobs. Finally, the public also benefits from this group of people as they help to finish the necessary work.

On the other hand, I disagree with the idea that serving the community without any financial incentive should be voluntary. One reason is that the amount of work that needs to be done at school is already enormous. Children nowadays are forced to attend several cram schools and extra classes, which, according to numerous parents, will help them to obtain better academic results. Another important factor is that youngsters need sometimes for themselves to develop their own interests, make some new friends or take up new sports.

In conclusion, although I accept that doing community service without payment is advantageous to both the society and students individually, I do not consider the idea that it should be made compulsory.
evaluation:
**Task Achievement:**

The essay adequately addresses the task by discussing the benefits of community service for teenagers and society while expressing disagreement with the idea of mandating unpaid work. prompt: Employment should give their staff at least a 4-week holiday a year to make employees better at their jobs. To what extend do you agree or disagree?
essay:
Holidays are provided by companies to their personnel for various reasons. Some employment grants sick leave, casual leave as well as annual leave as per policy. In my opinion, I agree that a 4-week break a year is a great idea to make institute prosper at their jobs. It gives department extra encouragement as well as helps them to mitigate personal issues to feel tension-free with the help of a long break.

To begin with, catalyst is a key factor that enables staff to do well in their duties and having a 4-week break annually definitely helps. For example, After getting such a long leave personnel will come back to their workstation with reinvented energy as whatever dissatisfaction they have will fade away by the time they join. It is a natural boost for department to do well. Above all, desire is always a major factor in any type of responsibility.

On the other hand, Felling relieved is always a welcoming factor for any employee and having a 4-week holiday in a year job holders can easily solve their personal issues. According to  recent research by a Workforce provider organization, staff who stay tension-free in their job from personal issues do significantly well than those who don't. Relived employees from any type of family problems are always a plus point. Finally, with a long leave, Any external factors can be easily manageable.

In a nutshell, encouragement and feeling relief are key factors that contribute to workers' performance. The working personnel is the backbone of any nation or company, the smooth working of the organization depends on the wellness and contentment of the labour pool. There are various reasons that motivate the public to work in an industry some of the reasons can be the security of getting a paycheck at the end of every month which is unlikely if you own a business or work as a freelancer, business owners can bare a loss in their business which many people are not ready to accept. Having a regular salary paid monthly gives the common man a sense of stability and safety in their life. While money is the critical aspect for being a part of the labour pool many people are programmed from their childhood to get a degree and secure a good paying job in a reputed company, the idea of staring a business or a startup is generally frowned upon because of the instability and persistence it requires to establish and run a successful business.

What we conclude from this is that money plays a crucial role for the public to join the workforce many people are ready to work under someone and have a secure job with constant flow of money with a stable life.

prompt:
There are several factors that motivate people to stay in the workforce, and 
money is the most important reason/factor. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
essay:
In any company, managers and leaders always have a concern about employee retention. an employee stays in the same role or job for many reasons, I agree that the most important reason to continue working is money. This essay will explain further.

Job satisfaction is the main responsibility of the Human Resource department in any industry and business and a lack of  this area will end up when an employee leaves the company. hence, the employee can be happy and satisfied with work for many reasons, for instance, financial income, reward program, career development and benefits,  we can say that there can be some career goals which compel people to stay in the work market and even make them stay work late hours. Professionals don't leave their jobs so that they can get more and more work experience and be awarded promotions and certain desired positions in long run. Even women are also in this race and not ready to compromise their careers on the family because they also have the motives of getting  managerial positions. Besides this, the masses work to get job benefits, for instance, insurance and free vacations with family to Europe and other fascinating destinations. 

In addition to this, on 2017 Hilti company hired an external agent to make a survey for their employees about major issues that affect performance as well as how much they believe in long service in the company, the results were surprising  90% of the employees are searching for another opportunity outside due to money, hence, this made the management to take serious actions, for example, salary review and set the salary benchmark against market standards. moreover, many researchers have done about employee satisfaction through recruiter agencies and institutes found out that 70% of employees can be productive at work when they are well paid and their income is enough to cover their daily expenses.

In conclusion, money is a very important factor for employees to be productive and stay in the company, hence companies should take serious actions for this reason, such as yearly review of the salary and ensure employees are well paid by adding a bonus system for a productive employee or achieving the targets or else the company will face serious issues on employee retention as well as, company performance.

prompt: Some people think that museums should be enjoyable places to entertain people, while others believe that the purpose of museums is to educate. Discuss both views and give you own opinion
essay:
Every person has different beliefs about a purpose of museums. The majority of people believe that museums should be visited as an entertainment while others think that this place is to educate. In my opinion, I see museums as a place where people can do both fun and get knowledge.

On the one hand, not everyone in this world enjoy visiting a monument because most of the people are not really interested in history or geography. Furthermore, they will be bored if there is no something funny to see. For instance, research reveals that more than 30% of teenagers that went to museums felt no enjoyable. Some of them even wanted to go home earlier. As a result, a function of museums should be added more to be entertain.

On the other hand, generally, museums are related to history, and some of them contain many ancient artefacts and weapons. This purpose is to give public new knowledge about our past conditions or how our heroes sacrificed themselves. For example, in Yogyakarta, there is a house that constructed into a museum that show Indonesian history. Because of this, tourists and visitors can see real-life example of a country history, and they can get education that they can not get in schools.

In conclusion, although a function of museums is to educate people, it is not wrong to turn museums into entertainment places.

essay:
These days, public debate has been going on over whether museums should amuse or enlighten humans. Both viewpoints can be grounded with compelling arguments, which are key for understanding the reasons behind conflict and can broaden one’s horizons, therefore, will be analyzed.

To embark on, a pleasurable experiences in museums would have a range of benefits for the society. To start with, a higher attendance of the institutions would be provoked. For this reason, more tickets would be bought and higher sums of money collected. The financial savings could be used for virtuous purposes when, for example, state museums would give them to the government. The latter undeniably has a dozen of opportunities for investment, including social projects that increase the welfare of the country. Moreover, some museums might become a cheap option for entertainment. If more people can afford the latter, they will have more opportunities for unwinding themselves. Undoubtedly, relaxing and resting after a workday is indispensable for being productive the next day. Eventually, workers could produce more value for their land or environment with their work. 

	But the assertion that museums should serve the purpose of teaching people, has convincing justifications too. One of them is that the facilities could evoke curiosity about the culture along with traditions of a land. This may catalyze the development of national pride and patriotism. Consequently, individuals pursuing such values would get motivated and have an incentive to collaborate, work hard for the nations well-being and promote peace in their surroundings for achieving that. Furthermore, expositions might spark curiosity about some subjects. As a result, there would be more young personas inspired about science, hence, interested in studying. If they learned more, they would acquire more skills for possibly inventing something in the future. If it would turn out to be so, the inventions could help the society like electricity does.

	This leads to the conclusion that making museums a place, which is fun to come to, and utilizing them for enlightening members of the society has a multitude of merits. On the basis of the above discussion it might not be clear for what one should opt for, however, it may be manageable somehow for museums to fulfill both needs and solutions for that should be sought after.
